She used her Kiva loan to recharge her business giving her clothes better finishing touches and quality and she also improved her production time.

María says that Kiva’s been a blessing for her because she’s been able to finance her business with the loans.  She’s currently applying for a new loan to buy raw materials and supplies to respond to orders for sports and school uniforms that she sells on credit.  This will be a successful investment because it encompasses customer orders that she must respond to.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 30 years old. He has been in this business for the past six years. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during his maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming, he wants to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during his maize production

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie Gorette is 50 years old. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business, so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Eneris

texts.es: Eneris de 33 años de edad, conforma una familia con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 13 años. Ella hace 8 años, es  manicurista  y se dedica también a la actividad comercial, mediante la cual vende productos de belleza  y artículos variados por medio de guías especializadas  Cuando empezó su vida productiva, decidió inclinarse por el aprendizaje de la belleza de manos y desarrolló su experiencia entre familiares y amistades; posteriormente agregó a esta empresas multinacionales para vender artículos mediante catálogos. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado, trabajando todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde sin cesar. Hoy está aun mas dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio, aumentando la lista de su clientela, para ampliar sus ingresos, cada vez más. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumería, cremas, accesorios femeninos, con el fin de iniciar su sueño de prosperidad, que se dará poco a poco, ampliando los plazos de financiamiento, como los tiene su competencia lo que es su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Eneris, 33, has a family consisting of her spouse and two children who are 9 and 13 years old.  She’s been a manicurist for 8 years and also a merchant selling beauty products and varied items via specialized catalogs.  

When she started her productive life she decided to become an apprentice to learn how to provide hand beauty services and she acquired experience among her family members and friends.  Later on, she added multinational firms to sell their products via catalog.  She sells for cash and on credit and works every day from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening non-stop.  Today, she’s even more determined to make the business grow increasing the number of her customers and expanding her income more each time.  

This is the reason for her Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she will use to buy perfume, creams and women’s accessories aiming at starting her dream of prosperity that will gradually come to be.  She will lengthen her payment terms to match her competition’s which is her greatest challenge.

loans.use: to by perfume, creams and women's accessories.

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Steven, who is a married man with six grown up children, has been managing his life by running several businesses, one is a charcoal selling business, a second is a poultry business where he grows broilers for sale and trades local chickens which he buys from others to resell. Steven is managing another business of fruits and vegetables- he owns a farm for some fruits and vegetable items which he sells.  Steven, who is in his early seventies, works from 06:00am to 09:00pm every working day and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is Steven's fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to purchase more sacks of charcoal, fruits, and vegetables, and has paid back all his previous loans successfully. Steven used his business profit to cover household expenses and saved the remainder. He will use this loan to purchase more chicks and local chickens. Steven dreams of owning better working equipment and transportation.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "mango" which totals 6 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and local chickens.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
La señora Corina de 60 años de edad es casada y se dedica la elaboración y venta de rosquillas, sus ventas son dos veces por semana, este producto lo elabora y luego lo entrega a sus clientes quienes ya tienen contrato con ella.
Doña Corina también vende quesillo, tiene crianza de cerdo y también tiene ganado, se dedica a esta actividad desde 10 años, sus clientes le prefieren por la calidad de sus productos.
Doña Corina está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, harina, soda, manteca, etc.  y poder así seguir elaborando sus productos con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio.
Doña Corina su sueño  es comprar un vehículo para transportarse con su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Corina, 60, is married and works making and selling ‘rosquillas’ [traditional cookie].  Her sales take place twice weekly.  She makes the cookies and then delivers them to her customers who already have contracts with her.

Corina also sells cheese raises pigs and cattle.  She’s been in this business ten years and her customers prefer her because of the quality of her products.

Corina’s asking for the loan to buy corn, firewood, flour, baking soda, shortening, etc. to be able to continue making her products.  She hopes the profits and support from this loan will help her get ahead and continue improving her business.  Corina’s dream is to buy a vehicle to transport herself in her business.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2013.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, flour, baking soda, shortening, etc.

loans.name: Perus

texts.en:
Perus is 34 years old. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is 50 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Kalipa

texts.ru: Калипе 63 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 8 детей. У Калипы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Калипа занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 9,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Калипы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 50 овец, а также имеет 3,0ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калипа обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Калипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома для сына.
texts.en: Kalipa is 63 years old, married and raising eight children together with her husband. Kalipa has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, Kalipa is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 9,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kalipa's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 horse, 50 sheep and also three hecteares of land, where she annually grows beans and potatoes. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Kalipa requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount. Kalipa plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a new house for her son.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
Armando  es habitante de la comunidad de Dipina en esta  comunidad vivió con sus padres y estudio en la escuela  de la comunidad en la que curso segundo grado de primaria nada mas. Ya que se dedico después a trabajar con su papa en los labores del campo,al crecer su padre le heredo un terreno donde construyo su casa y en las tierras siembra cacao ademas de tener ganado.la leche de vaca la vende diario  a comerciantes de la zona que se dedican hacer queso y el cacao que cosecha lo vende en una comunidad cercana.
Armando  vive con sus esposa  con quien ha procreado 10 hijos  teniendo el menor de ellos 5 meses de nacido. su familia no gozan de tener energía eléctrica en su hogar y es triste pues la necesitan mucho.Es por eso  que el desea adquirir  un sistema solar para su vivienda .
texts.en:
Armando lives in the community of Dipina.  He lived here with his parents and went to school in the community here finishing second grade in elementary school only because he started to work in the fields with his father.  When he grew up, his father passed down to him a piece of land where he built his house and where he also grows cacao beans; he also raises cattle there.  He sells the cow milk every day to local merchants that make cheese and he sells the harvested cacao beans in a nearby community.

Armando lives with his wife with whom he’s had 10 children the youngest being 5-months-old.  His family does not have electricity at home and it’s sad because they need it very much which is why he wants to get a solar system for his house.

loans.use: to buy a home solar energy system.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a 57 year old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 35 years. She describes herself as an honest, self motivated individual and a go-getter. She operates a grinding mill where she grinds maize and also sells cereals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of clean and safe water for family use. She will use the KES 9000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for family use by 6 family members. She hopes that in the future, she will improve living standards of the family through supply of clean and sufficient water for use. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of  KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
This is Dorris. She previously accessed a loan that she used to renovate her food stand. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Kshs 30,000 (Kenyan shillings) to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 57-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 20 years to 35 years. She describes herself to be committed and self-motivated. She sells charcoal to earn a living. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of clean and safe water for family use. She will use the KES 9,000 (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for family use by eight family members. She hopes that in the future, she will raise a happy and healthy family through improvement of their sanitation. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Doña Reyna es una mujer luchadora de 40 años de edad la cual es casada y en compañía de su esposo y sus 7 hijos se dedican al cultivo de café los cuales todos viven con ella bajo el mismo techo. El mayor tiene 20 años y trabaja junto a su padre en otras tierras dando mantenimiento al cultivo de café al igual que el tercero de sus hijos el cual tiene 14 años de edad, el segundo tiene 17 años y trabaja en la venta de películas en un negocio comercial, el cuarto hijo tiene 13 años está en quinto grado, el otro hijo tiene 10 años y está en tercer grado, el penúltimo hijo tiene 8 años y está en segundo grado y el ultimo tiene 7 años y está en primer grado y todos ellos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella anteriormente solo se dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos pero hace más de dos años decidió empezar con el rubro del café y este año será su primera cosecha. En este año ella se involucrara en su propia recolecta por lo que está muy feliz ya que en tiempo anterior lo hacía en otras tierras para obtener ingresos. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, fertilizantes, urea entre otros para preparar sus cultivos de café para esta cosecha. 
Su meta es seguir luchando para poder vivir mejor, arreglar y sembrar más café para que sus hijos vivan mejor ya que tiene la esperanza de verlos crecer y podrán comprar más terrenos así obtener mayores ingresos ya que ella quiere ahorra para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos y que ellos estudien y se gradúen.
texts.en:
Reyna’s a hardworking, 40-year-old, married woman living with her husband and seven children who work growing coffee.  All of them live with her under the same roof.  The oldest is 20 and works alongside his father on other land providing coffee crop maintenance just like her third son who is 14.  Her second son is 17 and works selling movies in a commercial firm.  Her fourth son is 13 and in 5th grade and her other son who is 10 is in third grade.  Her next-to-last son is 8 and in second grade and the youngest is 7 and in first grade.  All attend the local school.  She used to work doing housework and caring for her children but over two years ago decided to start growing coffee and this year will have her first harvest.  She will take part in her own harvesting and she’s very happy about this because previously she did so on other land to earn income.

She’s asking COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like manure, leaf fertilizer, fertilizer, urea and others to prepare her coffee crops for harvest.  Her goal is to continue striving to live better, to plant more coffee so that her children will live better since she hopes to see all of them grow and be able to buy more land to earn higher income since she wants to provide her children with better futures, that they study and graduate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: G.s Claridad Group

texts.es:
G.S. CLARIDAD está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras con cinco hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos le libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligadas a  trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es Ruth y tiene por actividad económica la venta de frutas y verduras en un lugar establecidos de uno de los mercado de la localidad. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El G.S CLARIDAD agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Claridad” (Clarity) communal bank consists of three members; single mothers with five children in their care. They are from León, a place located in the west of the country.  These women are noted for being hardworking and responsible with self-improvement drives.  They enjoy being in company of their children in their free time.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources they were unable to study careers and were obliged to start working at a young age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to their effort and desire to get ahead, the bank coordinator is Ruth.  Her activity is selling fruit and vegetables in a fixed location in one of the local markets.  She spends about 8 hours daily in her business selling her products.  She does so very happily.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the not too distant future she will be able to earn higher income.  The Claridad group thanks Kiva lenders for the support provided to people of scarce resources an poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Here is 24-year-old John who comes from the Kisii area of Kenya. Like many residents of Kisii who grow bananas and sugarcane, John has ventured in farming for two years and owns a cow, poultry, mosquito net, and TV. He does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile, sewing machine, or DVD, and does not have electricity, solar power, or running water.

His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops, including bananas and sugar cane. Though his challenge in farming is marketing his farm produce, he enjoys every activity that farming entails. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for the loan, he said that it gives loans to small-scale farmers. The key learnings he received during the microfinance training sessions were, "how to manage a loan and improve (my) life.”

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, John said that he would buy a dairy cow, and so increase milk production.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials to cook snacks.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine is a mother of two children and is aged 46. She has been a maize farmer for the past ten years. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Carlos David

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona de 43 años de edad, agricultor, vive con su esposa y 2 hijos, es conocido en la comunidad por su manera de trabajar, ya que padece de un impedimento físico en su mano derecha; pero no es limitante para que pueda ejercer sus actividades , su esposa es un apoyo incondicional, para desempeñar las actividades tanto familiares como materiales. 
Carlos se dedica específicamente a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió directamente de su papá, cuando tenía una temprana edad, por el tiempo de trabajo e instituciones presentes en la zona que fortalecen dichos conocimientos, él desempeña sus actividades de buena manera y se fortalece cada día.

El dinero será invertido en la recolección de la cosecha, también pretende fortalecer una pequeña tienda que posee su esposa y de esa manera diversificar los ingresos en el hogar.

El señor menciona que en un futuro, pretende trabajar un poco más fuerte, teniendo el apoyo de sus hijos, también salir bien con el compromiso, para mantener siempre el apoyo en cualquier actividad que pretenda realizar.
texts.en:
Carlos, 43, works in agriculture.  He lives with his wife and two children and is known in the community for his way of working for he has an impediment in his right hand.  But this doesn’t limit him to do his activities.  His wife’s his unconditional support for both family and material activities.

Carlos works in agriculture specifically, an activity he learned directly from his father at a young age.  Because of the time he’s worked and thanks to institutions in the zone that strengthen said skills, he does his work well and becomes stronger every day.

The money will be used to bring in the harvest and he also intends to strengthen the small store his wife has to diversify household income.  He mentions that in future he intends to work harder with help from his children as well as to repay the loan so that he will always have access to support for whatever activity he intends to carry out.

loans.use: to buy goods for his wife's store and to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Yeny De La Paz

texts.es:
Yeny es una persona de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 1 año de edad, posee buenas cualidades , destacando entre ellas la responsabilidad y el deseo de superación; su esposo que también es joven, es emprendedor muy identificado con la institución y su hija es la razón de su esfuerzo y lucha permanente , para ofrecerle lo mejor en el futuro. 

Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, al cuido de su hija y de su esposo, y en la actualidad se desempeña como dependiente en una tienda en el municipio.

El financiamiento será invertido, en la compra de medicamentos, ya que su hija presenta problemas de salud y necesita algunos exámenes médicos, para determinar su diagnóstico real.
Yeny desea, continuar trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones, tener una casa propia y ver crecer a su hija de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Yeny, 32, lives with her husband and one-year-old daughter.  She has good qualities among which are responsibility and the desire for self-improvement.  Her husband is young too.   He’s enterprising and quite identified with the institution.  Their daughter is the reason for their constant effort and struggle, to provide her with the best in future.

She does domestic chores and cares for her daughter and husband and currently is employed in a store in town.  The loan will be used to buy medicine because her daughter has health problems and needs some medical tests to determine the true diagnosis.  Yeny hopes to continue working to improve her conditions, to own a house and to see her daughter grow better.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her daughter.

loans.name: Gumercindo Alfredo

texts.es: Gumercindo vive en la comunidad de peñas blancas desde los 6 años de edad.El no pudo asistir  a la escuela  sin embargo aprendió a leer y escribir  de forma autodidacta, el a trabajado en los cortes de café del departamento de matagalpa estando en una de las haciendas cafetaleras donde trabajada  le pidió  a uno de los conductores que le enseñara a conducir y aprendió bien rápido, lo que le permitió poder ganarse la vida mas cómodamente por que consiguió un empleo como conductor de un camión. El tiene 8 hijos todos ya son adultos ,algunos de ellos le ayudan a trabajar, ya que logro comprar un terreno  y este lo comparte con su hijo mayor .Don Gumercindo desea obtener el crédito para tener energía eléctrica en su vivienda ya que en su comunidad no hay energía convencional
texts.en:
Gumercindo has lived in the community of Peñas Blancas since he was six years old. He wasn’t able to go to school; however, he taught himself to read and write. He used to work on one of the the coffee-growing haciendas in the department of Matagalpa where he asked one of the drivers to teach him how to drive. Gumercindo learned very quickly and this allowed him to earn his living more easily. He found a job driving a truck.

He has eight grown children, some of whom help him on his land. He managed to buy a piece of land and now shares it with his eldest son. Sr. Gumercindo is seeking a loan to install solar electricity in his home since in his community there is no regular electricity system.

loans.use: buy a solar system for his house

loans.name: Dilia Damaris

texts.es:
Dilia es una joven de 27 años de edad madre de dos hijos de los cuales el mayor de ellos esta en la primaria y el menor es de meses de edad de nacido el cual aun esta en lactancia. Ella es casada y tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el 5 grado ya que no pudo completar sus estudios por la falta de apoyo de sus padres ya que ellos no tienen una excelente o buena situación financiera. Ella es una joven muy feliz a pesar de todo y diariamente temprano por la mañana se levanta para hacer el desayuno de su hijo y su esposo el cual trabaja como barbero en ocasiones y también como agricultor. Su esposo es la única compañía y apoyo en el trabajo de la tierra ya que ellos se dedican a la caficultura heredando la tierra que ellos trabajan de sus padres la cual se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos caminando.

Sus sueños son los de seguir trabajando en la tierra para seguir ampliándola y seguir fortaleciendo el patrimonio mediante la compra de mas tierra y la siembra de mas chapola la cual pueda ser mas atractiva para sus cultivos generando mas ingresos y asegurando el futuro de sus hijos. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que dará mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café para poder sacar una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Dilia, 27, is a young mother of two children.  The older one attends elementary school and the younger is just a few months old and still nursing.  She’s married and completed fifth grade since she was unable to continue any further because of the lack of support from her parents since they didn’t have a good or excellent economic situation.  She’s a very happy young woman despite everything and rises early every day to prepare breakfast for her son and husband who works as a barber and sometimes in agriculture.  Her husband is her only company and support working the land since they work growing coffee on land located a 30-minute walk away inherited from their parents.

Her dream is to continue working the land to continue expanding and strengthening their assets buying more land and planting more to make her crops more attractive to generate higher income and ensure her children’s future which is why she’s asking COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan to buy agricultural supplies to provide coffee crop maintenance to obtain excellent yields.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: José Wilfredo

texts.es:
José es un joven de 20 años, estudio  hasta bachillerato, esta acompañado y su pareja le ayuda a trabajar en la siembra de hortalizas y maíz, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, pero no dependen de él,

él  se dedica a la siembra de pipían, tomate, chile, pepino y maíz,desde que tenia unos 10 años, ya que su papá siempre se a dedicado a ese cultivo; fue él quien le enseño el trabajo. Hoy que esta acompañado, continua trabajando desempeñando esa misma actividad, pues por la misma pobreza ya no pudo seguir estudiando, pero sueña con seguir estudiando y ser un agronomo. Además, de la agricultura se dedica, a la música con sus hermanos y unos amigos tienen un grupo musical, con el que sueña llegar muy lejos, 

El crédito, sera invertido en la construcción de una pequeña vivienda,  pues  hoy que esta acompañado desea tener su propio espacio. Con el préstamo, comprara dos docenas de lamina, 10 cuartones,  6 vigas, y  6 horcones.   

Su sueño, es poder construir, su propia vivienda y mejorar su grupo musical, con la ganancia espera  ir pagando, la deuda y dejar las puertas abiertas.
texts.en:
José is a young 20-year-old who has a high school degree. He has a spouse who helps him plant vegetables and corn. José lives with his parents and two siblings, but they do not depend on him. 

José had made a living planting squash, tomato, peppers, cucumber, and corn since he was ten years old because his father has always grown these crops. It was his father who taught him to work. Now that he has a spouse, he continues to work carrying out this same economic activity. Due to poverty he was not able to continue studying but he dreams of continuing his studies to become an agronomist. In addition to the agricultural work he carries out, he is in a musical group with his siblings and friends with whom he aspires to go very far. 

The loan will be invested in the construction of a small home. Now that he is married, he would like his own space. With the loan he will buy twenty-four metal sheets, ten planks, six beams and six wooden posts. 

His dream is to build his own home and improve his musical group. With the earnings he hopes to pay his debts and keep doors open for him.

loans.use: to buy twenty-four metal sheets, ten planks, six beams, and six wooden posts to build his home.

loans.name: Fanny Edith

texts.es:
Fanny es una mujer que ha sobrepasado varios obstáculos en su vida; considera que uno de los más grandes fue el divorcio con su esposo con lo que además ha tenido que educar a sus hijos ella sola. Sin embargo ellos ahora son mayores de edad y le ayudan eventualmente a Fanny en su trabajo pero cada uno lleva una vida y familia independientes. Vive sola en el cantón Puerto Quito  de la provincia de Pichincha, uno de los lugares más visitados en el Ecuador por sus caudalosas cascadas y ríos y sus frondosos bosques que en cada uno podemos encontrar a personas con espíritu emprendedor y aventurero que fomenta el turismo a través de los deportes extremos y tours por los alrededores. Además en este cantón la actividad económica más común es la agricultura y ganadería, pues el clima es muy favorable para la siembra de distintas frutas tropicales y verduras que son muy cotizadas en el mercado nacional e internacional. 
Fanny se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de pollos de campo y pollos “pio”, actividad que comenzó por iniciativa propia y con una baja inversión y conforme fue creciendo el negocio tanto en demanda y rentabilidad, ella también decidió ampliarlo comprando más pollos. Dentro de las tareas más complicadas es cuidar a los pollos bebés pues son muy propensos a distintas enfermedades como la Viruela o gripe. 
Fanny sueña con posicionarse en el mercado agrícola y tener una empresa distribuidora de pollos, huevos, balanceado, animales de granja y que sea conocida a nivel nacional. Como primer paso para hacer realidad este sueño ella requiere un préstamo con el cual pueda comprar más pollos y ampliar y mejorar la estructura de los galpones donde tiene los criaderos. Además está pensando en comprar un par de cerdos para también criarlos y comercializarlos en el mercado local. 
Fanny espera que con este préstamo pueda obtener las utilidades para seguir invirtiendo y hacer crecer su negocio poco a poco hasta hacer realidad sueño y además poder tener un estilo de vida de calidad. Ella agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por su intervención para que ella obtenga el financiamiento necesario para dar este paso tan importante en su vida.
texts.en:
Fanny lives alone in the canton of Puerto Quito, in the province of Pinchincha, one of the most visited places in Ecuador. It has mighty waterfalls and rivers, and dense forests. Enterprising and adventurous people promote tourism through extreme sports and tours in the outdoors. Agriculture and animal-raising are also common ways of earning a living. Tropical fruit and vegetables grow well in the climate there, and the produce is highly valued nationally and internationally.

Fanny earns her living raising and selling different kinds of chickens. She started the business on her own initiative and with a small investment she made the business profitable. She decided to expand and bought more chickens. Amongst the most difficult tasks is care of the baby chicks because they are susceptible to diseases such as smallpox and flu.

Fanny’s dream is to position herself as a distributor of chickens, eggs, nutritional food, and farm animals on a national level. As a first step in fulfilling this dream, she needs a loan to buy more chickens as well as expand and improve the sheds where she raises the chicks. She is also thinking about buying a pair of pigs to fatten and then sell in the local market. With the loan Fanny expects to make more money to continue investing in and gradually growing her business until she realizes her dream and improves her standard of living. She is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their help in providing the necessary money to  help her with such an important step in her life.

loans.use: buy chickens and pigs, and expand sheds where she raises them

loans.name: Yokub

texts.ru: Ёкуб добрый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 прекрасных детей. Его дочери 24 года, а сыну 22 года. Его жена кондитер и работает в кондитерском цехе. Ёкуб уже много лет занимается бизнесом. Он занимается купле продажей запчастей от автомобилей. Ёкуб должен оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, так как его сын Фарух учится в университете в Малазии. Фарух учится по специальности экономиста. Он учится успешно и получает хорошо и отлично. Фарух хочет после окончания университета возвращаться на родину и служить своему народу. Ёкуб запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Yokub is a kind and goal-oriented man.  He is married and raising 2 wonderful children - a daughter and a son.  His daughter is 24, while his son is 22.  His wife works as a pastry chef at a confectioner's shop, whereas Yokub is an auto parts dealer and has been managing his own business for several years.  

His son Farukh is studying at a university in Malaysia as an economics major and is doing well in his studies, getting mostly A's and B's.  After graduating, his son plans on coming back to Tajikistan to work for and serve his home country.  To help pay for Farukh's university tuition, Yokub is requesting a loan of $5000 (USD).  He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay for his son's education in Malaysia

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto tiene 5 años de laborar como provedor de gas para cocinar, tiene una amplia clientela, por razones de seguridad debe cambiar todas las válvulas de los cilindros de gas que utiliza, y además restaurar el cajón del camión donde transporta el producto, para esto está solicitando un crédito por un millón cuarenta mil colonse (¢1.040.000), necesita este dinero para poder continuar con su proyecto y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Alberto has worked as a cooking gas provider for five years and has a large clientele. Due to safety reasons, he needs to change the gas cyliner valves that he uses. He also needs to restore his truck's storage unit where he transports the product. For this reason he is requesting a loan for 1,040,000 colones. He needs this money to continue his work and offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinder valves and a storage unit for his truck.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 51-year-old married mother of three children. Since 1998, she has been working in baking special "Saj", Lebanese traditional bread, to support her husband in making their living and covering most of their children’s needs. She is well known in her region for her special talent in this domain because of her long experience.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with extra flour and wheat. This applied-for loan will surely increase her income and develop her business, since she believes she's a successful business woman who knows the best way to respond to customers’ needs and requests.

Samira hopes to stay in good health to keep working on expanding and developing her business as much as she can.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with extra flour and wheat.

loans.name: Rapha (2) Group

texts.en:
Simon is one of the members of the group Rapha (2). The group consists of ten micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Simon is married with four children, whose ages range from 5 to 13 years old. Simon is very excited to be receiving his sixth loan from HOPE Congo after having successfully paid off his previous loans. 

He has had his business for around eleven years. His business is a small convenience store, selling many different items including cooking oil, sugar, peanuts, etc. With this next loan, he will be able to buy more of each of these items to further grow his inventory. By buying in bulk, he will be able to offer his products at a cheaper price than his competitors, increasing his sales. 

Simon hopes to continue to grow and diversify his store in the future. With future profits, he dreams of one day opening up a small boutique shop and maybe even a restaurant. He thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, peanuts, and other items.

loans.name: Luz De Maria

texts.es: Doña luz vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la  prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. doña luz confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz lives in her own house with her partner and their two children.  Luz has a shop where she sells staple goods such as beans, milk, eggs, bread and more.  She has had the business for many years and this has given her sales experience, allowing her to make higher profits.  The shop is in Luz's home, in an area which has many passers-by.  Luz has many customers as the shop is well stocked.  People prefer to come to Luz's shop and she stays ahead of the competition as she always has what people need, and quality products at accessible prices.  Attending to every customer the service Luz offers is unbeatable.  Like any good businesswoman, Luz wants to expand the business and invest more.  However, she needs capital and so is applying for a loan from "Integral" - this will allow her to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks, and more.  Luz is confident that this loan will help to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks, and more.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino es viudo, no tiene hijos que esten a su cargo ya que ellos ya son independientes; vive en casa propia en la zona Villa Marcelina de la ciudad de El Alto.

El Nivel de educación de Faustino es primario, actualmente percibe una renta de jubilación que le otorgan mensualmente.
 
El crédito lo requiere para pagar el costo de los tramites para regularizar la propiedad en su vivienda ante la Alcaldia y tener todo en orden.

El sueño de Faustino es dejar a sus hijos un lugar donde puedan vivie satisfactoriamente.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Faustino is a widower.  He doesn’t have children he is responsible for, because they are already grown-up. He lives in his own home in the Villa Marcelina zone of the city of El Alto.  Faustino’s education is at the primary level. Currently he receives a retirement stipend that is paid monthly.

He needs the loan to pay the cost of the paperwork and procedures in the mayor’s office to legalize the property where his home is, to have everything in order.

Faustino’s dream is to leave his children a place where they can live successfully.  This is the second loan he has asked for from IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for the paperwork and procedures in the El Alto mayor's office to legalize the property where his home is located.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene un hijo; vive en casa familiar en la zona de tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz

Actualmente aun trabaja en un taller de chaperia ubicado en la zona de Sopocachi con esta actividad el se mantiene y mantiene a su hijo.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una maquina pulidora y una compresora para de esta manera no perder clientes y mas al contrario dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y poder mantener o mejorar sus ingresos.

Es la quinta vez junto a IMPRO y la cuarta vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Cesar has a son and lives in the family home in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. Currently he is still working in a car body repair shop located in the Sopocachi area and by doing this he is able to maintain himself and his son.

Cesar is asking for a loan to buy a polishing machine and a compressor so that he does not lose any customers but instead will be able to provide them with a better service. This will enable him to maintain or increase his income.

This is Cesar's 5th loan with IMPRO and 4th loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a polishing machine and a compressor to be able to serve his customers more effectively.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz earns a living through her sari-sari or retail business selling various goods and items to the people in her community. Beatriz lives in the town of Ubay, Bohol with her husband and two children. Beatriz has been in the business for more than 10 years now.

Beatriz is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and beverages, cooking ingredients and other items. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks and attract more buyers thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store like canned goods, candy, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and beverages, cooking ingredients and other items.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with four school aged children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Catherine operates a fruit selling business selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenges are competition and the high cost of transportation. 

With a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of fruits of bananas, mangoes, and avocados for her fruit selling business. She dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits of bananas, mangoes, and avocados for her fruit selling business.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Yoeun, who is 57 years old, is a hard-working woman who has dedicated her life to agriculture, farming rice and raising poultry at home. It is a tradition of family farming passed on for generations. 

Normally, she is able to make a decent profit, though it is hard to cover her daily costs, so she always relies on another source of income by her husband, who is a wooden-house builder. She is the mother of two grown children, with whom she lives in her own house located in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province.

To help her in her farming business, she would like to apply for a loan of KHR 500,000 to buy fertilizer to provide good nutrition to her rice crops. She hopes to ensure better yields, which will help sustain her family’s daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial support with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to provide good nutrition for her rice crops.

loans.name: Bertin

texts.en:
Bertin is a young Cameroonian aged 32. He is married with no children. Bertin has been in the barber shop business for the past nine years which makes him very experienced and stable. He is likely to succeed in this business because it situated in an urban center with so many potential customers and  more so the number of years he has put in this business. 

A loan of 200,000 Central African CFA francs (XAF) will help Bertin purchase hair products for his barber shop. it is expected that this loan will help him increase his profit by 23 percent.

loans.use: to buy hair products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and has two children, one who is under school age and the other who is in school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills.

For the past four years, she has operated a green grocery shop selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other green grocery stores. She dreams of establishing a fruit parlour in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for her store. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for her green grocery store.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina lives in Vanadzor, which is in the Lori region. She has a son and a school-aged daughter. Her son is married and has two children and with his family he lives with Alina. He has his own fruit and vegetable trading business and he financially helps his mother. Alina herself has her own clothes trading business; she sells leather jackets for men, costumes, sweaters and trousers. She rents a stall at the Vanadzor city wholesale market. Alina, with the help of her son, brings the needed products from the wholesale market of Yerevan city. 

Alina asks for a loan of 900.000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to renew the collection of her stall and to buy warm clothes for the coming winter.

loans.use: to renew the collection of her stall and to buy warm clothes for the coming winter

loans.name: Oynisso

texts.en:
Oynisso is one of the smart members of her family who lives happily but poorly. She is 45 years old. She is a widow, and she is bringing up three children. 

Oynisso tries to provide them the high quality of living conditions. With this aim, ten years ago she began her own business selling "kuraga." She sells dried fruits at the local market. 

Oynisso wants to buy additional kuraga to develop her business assets and continue selling her goods.  Her income is small, and she can’t do it. She is asking for a loan of TJS 4,000 to buy kuraga to increase her working capital and develop her business. 

She awaits your support. She is kind.

loans.use: To buy "kuraga" to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl earns a living through her retail store. She lives in the town of Ubay, Bohol. Cheryl has three children aged 8, 5 and one. Cheryl has been in the business for more than 6 years now.

Cheryl is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. By doing this she will be able to cater for more buyers thus increasing her sales and income. In the future, Cheryl hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 40 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is married, with one child, who goes to school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Joan dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba, who is 35 years old, lives in the West Point area.  She did not go to school.  She is single and has three children between 7 and 17 years old, all living at home and in school.

For the past 18 years, she has been involved in the sale of soap powder, soft drinks, washing soap, tissue, etc.  Her main challenge is the large amount of competition in her community, but her business is going well. 

Kumba has requested this loan to purchase more soap powder, soft drinks, washing soap, tissue, etc., to resell. 

In the future, she would like to buy some land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap powder, soft drinks, washing soap, tissue, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 47 years old.  He is married and has been in the business of farming for the past 18 years.  He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizers to increase maize production.  With the farming profits he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school.  She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.  With the KES 10,000 loan she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 39 years old.  He is married with six children, all of whom attend school.  He has been in the business for the past sixteen years.  He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizers during maize production, as he needs fertilizer in order to increase their production.  With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Clescent

texts.en:
Clescent is 50 years old. He is married, with five children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production, He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is 32 years old, and she lives in the West Point area.  She did not attend school.  She’s single, and she has two children, aged 9 months old and 15 years old.  They both live at home, and the older one is school. 

She sells hinges, nails, door locks, etc. Her main challenge is the high cost of her purchases. What she likes about this business is selling to customers,  and it makes her proud of sending her children to school. 

Jannet has requested this loan to purchase more hinges, nails, door locks, etc. She will continue to use any profits to expand her business, and one day  she would like to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase more hinges, nails, door locks, etc., for resale

loans.name: Nonci

texts.en:
Nonci is a 42-year-old woman who is married to Akhim, a 45-year-old man. They are blessed with four children: Donny, 22, a college student; Jecky, 18, in the third grade of senior high school; Aky, 11, in the fifth grade of elementary school; and Esty, 7, in the first grade of elementary school.

Nonci initiated a pig breeding business two years ago. She usually raises pigs for seven to eight months before selling them. The selling price is around IDR 3,500,000 per pig, depending on the weight of the pig. The income from the business enables her to support the needs of her family and her children's school fees. 

Nonci has four pigs to rise at the moment, and one of them is ready to be sold. She desires to purchase more piglets to raise and also to build more room at her piggery.  Therefore, she has applied for a loan from TLM in amount of IDR 10,000,000. The loan will be spent on piglets and materials to build more room at the piggery.

loans.use: to buy piglets and materials to build more room at her piggery

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik lives in the village of Nerqin Hand, which is in the Syunik region.  For many years, Norik worked as a forester.  He now works as an inspector at the local reserve.  Norik is married and has two sons, both of whom are married and living separately with their families.  Norik’s wife works as an English teacher at the local school but, at the same time, she greatly helps her husband in his farming and agricultural activities.  In his farm, Norik breeds tree calves, thirty chickens, and several beehives.  He says the income from farming is too low, but if there is an opportunity to expand it he will manage run it cleverly and with a good profit.

He asks for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a few sheep, piglets, and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy a few sheep, piglets and animal fodder.

loans.name: Berquimas

texts.en:
Berquimas is 42 years old.  He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs fertilizer in order to increase production.  With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz de 36 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, como pantalones vestidos, camisetas, blusas. Este negocio inició desde hace 15 años, producto de la tradición heredada de su madre quien siempre se ha dedicado a la confección. Por eso Luz tiene una gran experiencia a la que ha agregado técnicas que aprendió en proceso de capacitación. Poco a poco ha ido estructurando su clientela  y hoy en día tiene una mayor infraestructura y su actividad ha sido muy exitosa. Sus principales productos de la oferta son las camisas, los pantalones y los tendidos., los cuales vende de contado, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza también de contado, en almacenes dedicados a proveer telas e insumos de confección, ubicados en la ciudad. En la actualidad, Luz está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos y demás insumos propios del proceso de la confección. Con ello se prepara con linda ropa para la temporada que se acerca, pues desde ya su clientela ha hecho sus pedidos y es que el aumento del volumen de sus ventas, con una inversión de un credikiva, aumenta la probabilidad de éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en: Luz is 36 years old and makes clothing such as pants, dresses, t-shirts, and blouses.  She has had this business for 15 years and learned it from her mother who has always been dedicated to dressmaking.  So Luz has lots of experience and she likes the techniques she learned in training.  Little by little she has been gaining customers and now she has a large infrastructure and she has been very successful.  Her main products are shirts, pants, and other clothing, which she sells for cash from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm.  She makes her purchases in cash from fabric and sewing suppliers in town.  Currently Luz is asking for a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies.  This way she will be able to have beautiful clothing for the upcoming season, since her customers have already placed their orders and her sales have increased.  This Kiva loan will increase her chances of success.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Thuch was born in Koh Kong province, where he currently lives with his parents and other siblings. He graduated from his high school this year with grade C, and he aims to move to Phnom Penh to pursue a university degree. He is majoring in electricity at the polytechnic institute. He is interested in this field since his father, who is a master electrician at a private company in the province, has taught him about this at very young age. His education’s fees are subsidized by his parents. 

He feels that he is a very lucky child in his family to graduate from high school and receive a higher education. Thanks to his parents and lenders who encourage him in his education and provides him this opportunity, Thuch (pictured here) will be furthering hs education with the funds from this loan. His mother Sarom is applying for this loan from Kiva, and she will be responsible for principal repayments. He will pay USD 380 for the first academic year program, and the rest of funds will go for materials needed to support his course.

loans.use: to pay for her son's first academic year and materials for his course.

loans.name: Dúo Luchar Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
DUO LUCHAR PARA TRIUNFAR
Doña Dora Fermana, es originaria de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 25 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus 3 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la venta de servilletas.
Desde hace algunos años ella empezó su propio negocio, ahora con el crédito que ella recibió le sirvió para poder comprar materia prima para poder elaborar sus tejidos, y también compro mas servilletas para venderlos.
El esposo de ella trabaja en una finca exportadora de flores, y gracias al poyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio, para tener mejores ganancias y asi mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos y para la compra de servilletas para vender.
texts.en:
DUO LUCHAR PARA TRIUNFAR

Fermana is originally from Tecpan Guatemala.  She’s 25 years old, has three young children, and makes typical weavings by hand and also sells serviettes.

She started her own business a few years ago and she used her loan to buy supplies to make her weavings and also bought some other serviettes to sell.

Her husband works on a farm that exports flowers and thanks to his support she can continue ahead with her business.

Her dream is to be able to expand her business so she can increase her earnings and send her children to school so that they can have a better future.  She is asking for this loan to buy supplies and serviettes.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 50 years old. She is the mother of three children.  She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. 

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her  farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Titiek

texts.en:
Titiek runs a small stall selling mobile phone accessories and airtime credits and processing bill payments. Titiek lives in Jakarta. She is married and has two children.

Titiek began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. She feels really excited about expanding her business. Last month, she made $200 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, she took out a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Daniel Alejandro

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 30 años de edad, trabaja como docente, ya que el estudio la carrera de educación y con el fruto de su trabajo puede sacar adelante a su familia ya que es padre de un niño de 2 años a quien quiere mucho y pro el cual se esfuerza cada día.

Daniel está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el  podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old and works as a teacher, because he studied for a career in education.  He is able to get his family ahead, since he is the father of two children whom he loves and are the reason that he works hard every day.

Daniel is grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help, he will be able to make improvements to the house where he lives and achieve his greatest dream, “Having a home of his own.”

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Dalia 1 Group

texts.en:
Nouha is the featured borrower of Dalia 1 Group.  She has gotten together with the other group members, who have always been neighbors and friends, in order to request a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua.

Nouha is a 47-year-old married mother of three children, who works in the tailoring business to help her husband make a living and cover their family's increasing expenses. She specializes in beads and pieces of work that require a very special talent.

Nouha is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her son's university fees.  She will keep on working hard to make sure that her son will finish his university studies and develop his own means of living.  She is the lady in the center of the picture holding the dress.  As for the other group members, Lina is the lady at the left with blue pants, and Dalia is the lady with green top.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university fees

loans.name: El Samaritano Tejeria Group

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela Azucena es casada. Tiene 47 años de edad. De escolaridad primaria completa. tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando. Se dedica a su tienda de artículos de consumo diario. Inició este negocio con poco capital y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando mercaderia para surtir su tienda. En el futuro desea tener una abarroteria y vender por mayor.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y agricultura.
texts.en:
Gabriela Azucena is 47 years old, married, and has an elementary school education.  She has five children and two of them attend school.  She has a small food store and started this business with little capital ten years ago.

She is member of this group and is asking for a loan so she can buy merchandise to stock her store.  In the future she wants to have a grocery store and sell in quantity.

The rest of the group’s members are merchants and farmers.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Alexie

texts.en:
Alexie is 23 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi would like to take a further loan to buy new furniture and soft drinks. Chi's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new funiture and soft drinks

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri, age 52, is a very kind and hard-working married man. He lives with his wife and a grown son in the littoral town of Kobuleti. 

Iuri is a joiner and manufactures window frames. His wife is a librarian, and their son works as a security guard at the petrol station. They get monthly salaries. 

The existing funds are too small, so Iuri decided to start up his own business. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, and the majority of the inhabitants are self-employed to make a living. To be able to start up his business, he is requesting a USD 4,200 loan. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. 

The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions, to rural vulnerable poor people who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the amount he is asking for, Iuri will found a metal and plastics workshop. He has purchased all the needed equipment for manufacturing and needs money to purchase materials for making doors and windows.

Iuri will manufacture and sell them at a good price, because demand is high in the region. He has already got a large quantity order and hopes his business will be lucrative in future. Iuri used to work as a hired worker in this kind of workshop, and he has proper experience in this field. 

This loan will be a great help for Iuri, to generate revenue and give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of materials for his metal and plastic workshop

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es: Carlos es un señor de 46 años de edad, originario de la ciudad Estelí, casado y sin hijos a cargo. Es pensionado, se dedicada al alquiler de cuartos en su casa y terrenos.  Sus ingresos lo recibe de la pensión, por el pago del alquiler de los cuartos y de los terrenos. Su meta próxima es mejorar su vivienda y dar comodidad a sus inquilinos. Solicita el financiamiento para saneamiento de vivienda con el fin de ofrecer las mejores condiciones, vivir de una manera cómoda y segura. Sus planes futuros es seguir ampliando su casa y construir más habitaciones para alquilarlos.
texts.en: Carlos is 46 years old and from the city of Estelí.  He’s married, doesn’t have any children, is retired, and rents out rooms in his house and on his land.  He receives an income from his pension and from the rents he receives.  His goal is to make improvements to his home and make it more comfortable for his renters.  He is asking for a loan so he can make the improvements, provide better conditions, and live comfortably and securely.  His plans for the future are to expand his home and build more rooms for renters.

loans.use: to make improvement to his boarding house.

loans.name: Eligenesi

texts.en:
Eligenesi is 64 years old. He is the father of five children, and he has been in the business of farming for the past 18 years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs for maize production

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 40 years old, and she lives in Kapan city. She graduated her school at the Yerevan city, but after getting married, she moved to Kapan city. She has two sons. Her husband works at the gas station. 

Gohar has her own business; she sells bed covers, bed linen, towels, bathrobes, and night dresses both for men and women. She rents a stall at the wholesale market of their city. She is very satisfied of her business since the assortment of her stall is great, and she always has a lot of customers.
