She brings her stall product from Yerevan city once a month by the help of her husband.

She asks a loan of AMD 800,000 in order to buy a new collection of products for her stall.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of products

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Chann, aged 25, is single man who resides with his parents in Svay Rieng province. After graduation from grade 12 of high school in 2009, he was one of the candidates who took an exam to be a secondary school teacher. He successfully passed it and has been a state school teacher for two years already. 

Chann found that his current salary is not enough to support his family’s living needs, so he would like to continue his education at the university in Phnom Penh and receive a degree, which will allow him to take another state exam to be a high school teacher.

To help him achieve his plans, he has applied for a loan of $500 USD to pay both tuition and non-tuition fees for the first academic-year program. The whole course of study will last only 20 months. Chann appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to programs like Kiva via its partners, which have supported his education individually.

loans.use: to pay both tuition and non-tuition fees for the first academic year program.

loans.name: Jeovanny Omar

texts.es:
Jeovanny, necesita invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas para cultivar maíz y frijol, sabe que cuando utiliza bien los créditos los resultados son buenos: como mayor producción mejores ingresos salido de las deudas. Comprara abono, herbicidas, insecticidas. 

 Su condiciones familiares han mejorado su economía se estabilizo y sigue alimentado el sueño de brindarles una educación superior a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jeovanny needs to invest in the purchase of farming supplies in order to cultivate corn and beans. He knows that when loans are put to good use, they have good results such as a better production, higher profits, and a way out of debt. Jeovanny will buy fertilizer, weedkiller, and insecticide. 

His family's circumstances have improved and his finances have stabilized. He keeps nurturing his dream of providing his children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weedkiller, and insecticide.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 42 years old and lives in West Point.  She is single and has four children between 8 and 28 years old.  For the past ten years, Annie has been operating a small shop where she sells bitter-cola.  What she likes best is that most of the time she doesn’t run out of money, and the profit she earns is used for upkeep of her home.  Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter-cola.  She hopes to own her own house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter-cola.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla is a 51-year-old married mother of three children, who has worked as a hair dresser for the last eight years to support her husband in covering their family's increasing needs.

Nahla is a Lebanese woman, who is sacrificing her life for the sake of providing her beloved children with the best living ever. Just like all the Lebanese women, Nahla is suffering from the unjust law which doesn't give the Lebanese mother the right to provide her children the Lebanese nationality.  She has to renew her children's residence permit every year so that they can stay living with her in Lebanon legally. 

For this reason, Nahla is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her son's residence permit expenses since he has his father's  Jordanian nationality.  Nahla is working hard and seeking perfection in her business, and hopes that one day the Lebanese laws that deal with women's rights will develop and be fair in a way that fits women's needs.

loans.use: To pay for her son's residence permit expenses since he has his father's Jordanian nationality

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Mwamini, who is in her early 30s, is married with five children. She has three boys and two girls who are in school. Since 1996, Mwamini has been running a mamalishe business selling food (breakfast, lunch, and supper). She works from 8am to midnight and is able to obtain a good profit every month. 

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more food supplies for her mamalishe business. With the previous loan, which has been paid back successfully, Mwamini restocked her business with food cooking supplies like rice, maize flour, baking flour, sugar, etc. With the business profit she received, she covered part of her home expenses and school fees. 

Mwamini dreams that one day she will be able to own a hotel.

Mwamini will share this loan with her loan group "DDC", which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food supplies for her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 30 years old and lives in West Point. She stopped her education at only tenth grade when she was 14 years old.

Amie has been operating a table where she sells ladies slippers. One of her main challenges is that she can’t keep up with the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies slippers for her business. In the future, she hopes to one day be a wholesale seller and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies slippers for her business.

loans.name: Jose Astul

texts.es:
Jose, se está preparando para la época de siembra por lo que opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar insecticidas, herbicidas, abono y semillas con los cuales preparara debidamente el terreno para obtener una productividad mayor, mejores ganancias, y seguir cumpliendo con sus compromisos de igual forma que lo hizo con el crédito anterior.
Ha mejorado su vivienda y sigue apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios, su familia sigue unida, y apoyándolo para salir adelente.
texts.en:
Jose is getting ready for the sowing season. That is why he is requesting a new loan: to buy insecticides, weedkiller, fertilizer, and seeds.  He will put them to use on his plot of land in order to improve his production, increase his profits, and keep up with his commitments the same as he did with his previous loan. 

Jose has improved his home and continues supporting his children in their education. His family is united, helping him to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, weedkillers, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 20 years old and lives in West Point.  She is single and has three children between the ages of five months to three years old.  All of her children live at home and the oldest one is in school.  

For the past two years she has been involved in the sale of slippers.  She learned this business by watching other business women.  Her main challenge is price control.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business.  She hopes to be a big business woman in the near future, and send her children to a quality school when the time comes.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Krubo

texts.en:
Krubo is 32 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has four children between the ages of one and eleven. All of them are living at home and only three are attending school. For the past 7 years she has been selling oil, vita, salt, etc. She enjoys her business because she has many customers. 

Krubo is requesting a loan to purchase oil, vita, salt, etc. for her business. In the future, she hopes to have a shop and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, vita, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Salomatjon

texts.en:
Salomatjon is 41 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and 2 children.  She has had her own business for 3 years, and it is her source of income.  She has been busy with cooking and selling pies, and also sells sugar, rice, beans, eggs, soft drinks and more. 

Salomatjon has not had many customers for the last period of time, and that’s why she has decided to widen the assortment of her goods. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS.  With this loan, Salomatjon is going to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts, as she wishes to satisfy the demand from her customers and always keep her store well-stocked. 

Salomatjon's goal is to always keep her business brisk, as it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Mbayuwayu Group

texts.en:
Scolastica is in her early 20s and is single.  She has been a food vendor since 2012.  She works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Scolastica's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to restock the out of stock items in the food store. She used the profit to pay for her college fees, saved some, and used the rest for loan repayments. She will use this loan to buy more stock of food like,  a sack of rice, 10 kilos of beans, a bucket of cooking oil, 50 kilos of maize flour, and more cold drinks.  She dreams of finishing college.

 Scolastica will share this loan with her loan group "MBAYUWAYU". The group has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food like a sack of rice, 10 kilos of beans, a bucket of cooking oil, 50 kilos of maize flour, and more cold drinks.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 38 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has four children between the ages of 8 and 20. All of them are attending school. 

For the past 7 years she has been selling charcoal. She always feels bad because she has many customers with low commodity. She is requesting a loan to purchase 50 bags of charcoal for her business.

One day, Cecelia hopes to have her own shop and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase 50 bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Josefa Maritza

texts.es:
Josefa  Maritza de 55 años de edad, casada con un hijo mayor de edad e independiente, originaria de león, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de actividades en familia. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de carne de res y cerdo, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Josefa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Josefa,  55 years old, is married and has one son, who is now grown and independent. Josefa was born in León, which is located in the western zone of the country. She is hardworking, responsible, and strives for success. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her family. Unfortunately due to financial hardship, Josefa was not able to study in college because she had to begin working at a young age in order to help with the family finances.

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to get ahead, she makes a living selling beef and pork. Her business is located in one of the municipal markets. Josefa works eight hours a day in her business, an activity she very much enjoys. 

The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the not-so-distant future, she will be able to earn more profit.  Josefa is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to those who have scarce resources at their disposal and are in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can find dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business, buying and selling beef and pork.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Fidelina de 52 años,  no tiene ningún nivel académico, vive junto a sus 2 hijos, entre las edades de 22 y 24 años quienes tienen un nivel académico de bachillerato general, que gracias a ello han podido obtener un empleo estable, también vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la producción agrícola. Fidelina se dedica a oficios domésticos en su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar lámina, bloque y cemento, para la construcción de la cocina porque la que tiene esta muy deteriorada.


Ella planea tener una vivienda, que reúna las condiciones necesaria, para su familia y sea de bienestar para todos y que en el momento de las lluvias no tengan que pasar fríos.
texts.en: Fidelina is 52 years old and has no formal education. She lives with her two children, ages 22 and 24, who both earned their general degrees and thanks to that have gainful employment. She also lives with her husband, who makes a living in agriculture. Fidelina is dedicated to taking care of the home. She is requesting the loan to purchase metal sheeting, cinder blocks and cement to build a kitchen because the one she has is very rundown. She plans to have a home that meets necessary living conditions for her and her family's well-being and so that they don't go cold when the rains come.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, cinder blocks and cement to build a kitchen because the one she has is very rundown.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr:
Ablaye est un jeune célibataire de 29 ans qui s’active dans l’aviculture depuis quelques années. Il loge dans un village situé non loin de la ville, la- bas il a de l’espace pour mettre une grande quantité de poussins. Seulement vu que c’est sa première expérience dans le crédit, il préfère prendre une somme  abordable pour l’instant. Il va acheter des poussins et leur aliment du démarrage jusqu'à la finition. Il possède une clientèle a qui il peut livrer les poussins a terme, il n’a donc pas de problème d’écoulement. 
C’est grâce à son activité, qu’il prend en charge la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et assure leurs besoins personnels. Pour cette opération, il a fait 100 sujets, il aimerait pouvoir élever jusqu'à multiplier par 10 c'est-à-dire 1000 poussins s’il a les moyens requis.
texts.en:
Ablaye is a 29-year-old single man, who in recent years has been active in the poultry industry. He lives in a village not far from the city, where he has space to put a lot of chicks.

Because this is his first experience with credit loans, he prefers to request an affordable sum for the time being. He will buy chicks and their feed from start to finish. He has a customer base to whom he can deliver the chicks once they are ready, so he does not have a stock flow problem.

Thanks to his business activity, he supports his family's daily expenses and ensures their personal needs. In his current operation he is raising 100 chicks. If he obtains the necessary resources he would be able to raise up ten times that amount,  that is 1000 chicks.

loans.use: buy chicks and poultry feed to raise and sell a term

loans.name: Kazoza Group

texts.fr:
Virginie fait partie du groupe Kazoza et habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de  40 ans .Elle a 2 enfants âgés de 10  à 12 dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de tourteaux depuis  4 ans.

Elle est à  son cinquième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva, qu'elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de tourteaux à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Virginia is part of the Kazoza group and lives in Gitega. She is a 40-year-old widow. She has two children aged 10 and 12 years, both of whom attend school.

She has been trading oilcakes (cattle feed) for the past four years.

This is her fifth credit loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of oilcakes for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a lot of oilcakes (cattle feed) for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Kalbubu

texts.ru: Калбубу 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Калбубу - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Калбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 38 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Калбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 лошадь, 30 овец, 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, а также имеет 3,40 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетнюю траву. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Калбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для младшего сына.
texts.en: Kalbubu is 57 years old, she is married and is raising six children together with her husband. Kalbubu has specialized secondary education and does animal husbandry and field crop cultivation as a main source of income for her family which she started 38 years ago with a purchase of livestock for 1,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Kalbubu now has one horse, 30 sheep, two milk cows, two calves and also 3.4 hectares of land where she annually grows beans, potatoes and perennial grasses. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. With the purpose to further grow her business Kalbubu has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som to buy a horse to increase her livestock headcount. Kalbubu plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock and save money to hold a wedding for her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy horse.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with six children and two of her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas on a retail and wholesale basis. She takes care of an additional family member - her mother).  She has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda Shillings 2,300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and transportation. She is aspiring to get a van for transporting green bananas and also to be selling on a wholesale basis only.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes  school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Zurabubu

texts.ru: Зурабубу 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Зурабубу - высшее образование, работает врачом в областной больнице. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Зурабубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зурабубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 лошади, а также имеет 1,26 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зурабубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зурабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Zurabubu is 54 years old, she is married and is raising three children together with her husband. Zurabubu has higher education and works as a doctor in the regional hospital. She does animal husbandry as an additional source of income for her family which she started 23 years ago with a purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Zurabubu now has one milk cow, two horses and also 1.26 hectares of land where she annually grows potatoes and wheat. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS. With the purpose to further grow her business Zurabubu has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som to buy a cow to increase her livestock headcount. Zurabubu plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock and save money for her children's further education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak is 28 years old and graduated from high school in the region of the Takeo province. He graduated since 2007 and didn’t have a chance to pursue his degree at the university due to his family’s financial constraints. Since the student loan is available for low-income people, he started to consider furthering his education and wants to receive a degree in the field of Marketing. He has a passion for his major because he is aware that this major is suitable for his personality.

Sopheak wants to borrow a loan of 800 US dollars to pay tuition fees for the first two academic-years of a course at Build Bright University. He understands that an education will give him the opportunity to get a high-paying job that will allow him to support his parents in the future. During this course, Sopheak plans to find a part-time job in order to help his parents repay the loan. Sopheak appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to programs like Kiva via its partners, HKL, which have supported his education individually and other low-income family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the first two academic-year course at Build Bright University.

loans.name: Qudbiddin

texts.ru:
Кудбиддин имеет высшее юридическое образование и предоставляет жителям своего района Хуросон юридические консультации. Одновременно Кудбиддин в течение 20 лет занимается животноводством. Еще в юности у его родителей был скотный двор и Кудбиддин им помогал ухаживать за животными. По сей день Кудбиддин держит скот у себя во дворе. Кормить, поить и следить за ними доставляет Кудбиддину одно удовольствие. Кудбиддин семьянин. У него пятеро сыновей в возрасте 30, 28, 27, 24, 19 лет и двое дочерей в возрасте 29, 14 лет. Двое сыновей находятся на заработках в другой стране. Жена и дочери занимаются растениеводством и в отсутствии Кутбиддина присматривают за скотом.  
Скоро зима и Кудбиддин готовит кров для имеющихся и будущих коров. Кудбиддин планирует купить 2-3 маленьких телят. Это позволит ему расширить его деятельность. Сумму, которую он просит в кредит для такого бизнеса является малостью, но такой суммы у Кудбиддина нет. Он надеется на Вашу доброту и заранее Вас благодарит!
texts.en:
Qudbiddin has a law degree and provides the residents of his district of Khuroson legal advice. At the same time Qudbiddin has been doing animal husbandry during twenty years. When he was young his parents had a cattle yard and Qudbiddin helped them to take care of the animals. Till this day he keeps the cattle in his yard. It's a pleasure to feed, give them water and look after them for Qudbiddin. He is a family man. He has five sons in the age of 30, 28, 27, 24, nineteen and two daughters in the age of 29 and fourteen. Two of his sons are working in another country. His wife and daughters are doing horticulture and look after the cattle when Qudbiddin is away.

The winter is coming soon and Qudbiddin is preparing the shed for the current and soon to have cows. Qudbiddin plans to buy two or three small calves. This will let him expand his business. The amount which he is asking for as a loan for his business is very small, but he does not have this money. Qudbiddin hopes for your generosity and is thanking you in advance!

loans.use: to purchase large horned cattle.

loans.name: Kimiyo

texts.ru: Кимиё прекрасная женщина. Она добродушная и трудолюбивая. Кимиё долгие годы живет вместе с мужем в мире и согласии. Она заботливая мать для своих детей. Кимиё более 22 года работает в поликлинике своего района уборщицей. Она честно выполняет свою работу. Кимиё не только наводит чистоту на работе и и дома она очень чистоплотная. Кимиё и ее муж имеют маленький доход. Ее муж работает в фермерском хозяйстве. Кимиё нуждается в поддержке. Она должна провести свадебное торжество ее дочери, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони. Этот займ поможет ей осуществить мечту ее дочери и сделать ее счастливой. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kimiyo is a wonderful woman. She is kind and hardworking. Kimiyo has been living with her husband for many years in peace and harmony. She is a caring mother of her children. Kimiyo has been working in the polyclinic of her region as a janitor for over 22 years. She does her job honestly. Kimiyo does not only keep cleanliness at work but is also very clean at home. Kimiyo and her husband have a very small income. Her husband works in the collective farm. Kimiyo needs support. She has to hold a wedding ceremony for her daughter, but does not have money. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni. This loan will help her realize her daughter's dream and make her happy. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding for her daughter.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is 24 years old. He works and lives with his mother. Now he works as a guard in the irrigation department. Additionally he takes up crop farming, like his fellow villagers do. Most of the local population have engaged in farming and animal husbandry. 

With his savings, Tural purchased a 1 hectare plot of land and sows barley, wheat, sugar beet and grass there. In order to fulfill his goal, he is taking a loan to buy a tractor. He hopes his work will not be without rewards and that next year, he will receive a bountiful harvest. Thanks to the loan, he will have an additional source of income, which will help him greatly improve his and his mother 's life and surely to get ready for marriage.

loans.use: Tu purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with seven children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop and sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail and whole sale basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.  She gets additional income from making and selling liquid soap. She has applied for a loan of Uganda Shillings 2,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy sugar, beans, rice, flour, cooking oil and materials for making liquid soap. She is aspiring to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent for the shop.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, beans, rice, flour, cooking oil and materials for maing liquid soap.

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en:
Baraa is an 18-year-old single lady who has been working as a make-up artist for three years.  She was only fifteen years old when she started this business, because she finds herself in this field.

Baraa is a hard worker who developed herself in a very special way and is working on expanding and developing her business in a very expert way.
She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a special make-up kit trolley, a new hair dryer and a newly released make-up kit. Through this acquired loan she will be easily able to of expand her business, and better meet her customers' needs and requests.
Baraa is working hard to open a big beauty salon where she can expect an increasing number of customers to serve.

loans.use: To buy a special make-up kit trolley, a new hair dryer and a newly released make-up kit.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, she has operated a vegetable stall from her home, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Kanyiginya Drama Actors Group

texts.en:
Kanyiginya Group is located in a trading centre. The group is comprised of mainly men and women who all deal in small scale agriculture and trade. 

Elizabeth is a single mother who lost her husband in a fire accident which also destroyed their house. She managed to set up a new house where she lives with her six children who are all in school. Elizabeth has a small poultry farm and she also runs a small retail shop with capital of UGX.200,000= which she runs alone.

She applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy poultry feeds, add more capital in her shop and use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children.  Elizabeth is a very hardworking and trustworthy woman.

Her major challenge is poultry diseases, but she hopes to overcome it with better farming methods.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works six days a week.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,800,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality, ever increasing prices of used clothes and transportation. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to get permanent residence.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Lubat

texts.ru: Лубат родилась в 1976 года. Она замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Лубат начала свой собственный бизнес 5 лет назад. Она начала свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Постепенно она развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она занимается купле продажей женской и детской одежды. Лубат торгует на местном рынке. Она торгует каждый день и зимой и летом. Из-за сильного труда она заболела. Ей надо срочно вылечиться. Однако она не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы купить лекарства и лечиться. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки лекарства. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lubat was born in 1976. She is married and is raising three children. Lubat has started her own business five years ago. She started her business buying and reselling children's clothing. She gradually developed it and at this time now sells women's and children's clothing. Lubat sells on the local market. She sells every day in the winter and summer. She became ill due to hard work and needs treatment as soon as possible. However she does not have enough money to buy medicine for treatment. Lubat is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni to buy medicine. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her treatment.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en: Malkhaz is a 46-year-old married man and lives with his grown son, daughter-in-law, grandson and retired father. Malkhaz’s wife works in Italy and sends a small amount of money to her family members. Malkhaz runs small scale agricultural business and owns a dairy cow whose milk is used in cheese products. He has a small vineyard and sells the harvested grapes seasonally. The existing funds are not enough for the family of five.  In order to generate more income, Malkhaz decided to purchase a second-hand car to use it as Taxi. He is an experienced and careful driver and hopes his initiative will be successful. A loan of $ 3,600 will help him to start a Taxi business. Malkhaz is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure his family members with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car and use it as a Taxi.

loans.name: Tereze

texts.en:
Tereze has been practicing livestock for the past 15 years as a means of income. She is in her fifties and has three children who attend school and a husband who she has to look after since he is disabled. “Tereze is a very loving and good natured lady” were some statements from her neighbors and people in the village.

A loan of 200,000 Albanian Lek that she is requesting will help her buy some land where she can plant more crops and veggies. The sales from the agricultural produce in addition to her current livestock activities will hopefully boost her family’s income.

Tereze will be very appreciative to all lenders for their financial help.

loans.use: to buy some land for planting.

loans.name: Arzuman

texts.en:
Arzuman is from Gyumri town where he lives with his mother. Many years ago Arzuman started to earn his living from a retail business. Now, after years of hard work, Arzuman has gained many customers who prefer to purchase clothing accessories only from him. He purchases clothing stock from a neighboring country and resells it in his local town. 

As the income from his retail business is very important for Arzuman, he needs financial support so that he can purchase a new stock of clothing to sell to his customers. Arzuman has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Arzuman to be able to enlarge his business and ensure better living conditions for his mother.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to resell to customers

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    NIETA est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments à l’image de  MARAMA qui est la femme assise  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diverses quantités de condiments  avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Nieta consists of five married women who, on average, are 34 years and have four children. They live in traditional extended families in the Torakabougou district of ​​the city Bougouni. They know each other through neighborhood ties, friendship, and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to boost business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first loan. This group of women sells condiments. 

Marama is the woman sitting in the photo. She intends to buy, with a loan, various amounts of condiments with wholesalers Bougouni. She sells at home and at the market, in cash and credit, to a clientele composed primarily of women. She plans to earn an average monthly income of 30.000 F CFA to be re-invested in the business and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Unu Nio Group

texts.en:
Hidaya, who is in her late twenties, is married with two children who are still small.  She has been running a general store for 5 years now.  She works from 8.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hidaya's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more stock of sugar, salt, beans, maize flour, cooking oil, rice, etc. to resell. She dreams of building her own house. Hidaya will share this loan with her group "UNU NIO," which has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, beans, maize flour, cooking oil, rice, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 37 years old. He is married and has been farming for the past six years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mishi operates a food selling business preparing dumplings that she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a restaurant business in the near future. With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Dionis

texts.en:
Dionis is 30 years old.  He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is 27 years old and he lives in the village Pambak which is in the Lori region. Hakob is married and he has a small son. Hakob has graduated Vanadzor Agricultural College and now he works at his village station as a man of duty. His wife works at the local hospital as a nurse. Hakob lives with his parents, wife and his son in a very nice and comfortable house. 

He asks for a loan of 250. 000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer, which his wife greatly needs on the basis of her specialty.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which his wife greatly needs on the basis of her specialty.

loans.name: Brayan Alex

texts.es: El Joven Brayan  tiene 19 años y es soltero,  estudia la carrera  licenciatura en auditoria, en una Universidad de La ciudad de la Paz, trabaja para pagar sus estudios su papá le ayuda en el pago de sus estudios, mientras le enseña un oficio,  este es el primer crédito con la institución,  Brayan va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como compra de una computadora, libros y material para sus estudios para terminar sus estudios que durara el tiempo 5 años. Brayan enfrenta retos en su estudios que son no cuenta con liquidez necesaria para comprar todo el material que se le exige en la universidad,  vive en la zona  8 de diciembre, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es trabajar en una empresa reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional.
texts.en:
Brayan is 19 years old and single. He is enrolled in audit studies at a university in La Paz. He works in order to pay for his studies and his father helps him with the expenses and teaches him about his profession. 

This is Brayan's first loan with this institution. He will use it to cover several expenses related to his studies such as buying a computer, books, and materials for his studies, which will take him five years to complete. 

Brayan is facing challenges to his studies such as lack of economic resources to buy the required materials. He lives in the area "8 de diciembre". His wish is that once he has finished his studies, he will work for a company that is well-known nationally and internationally.

loans.use: to buy a computer, books, and study materials

loans.name: Jose Adali

texts.es:
José, ha empezado a preparar todo para la siembra de maíz y frijol y necesita comprar tres sacos de abono para que su cosecha sea abundante; el capital anterior le ayudo para efectuar la adquisición de insumos agrícolas con lo que su producción fue más abúndate y los ingresos fueron mayores.
Sigue trabajando por ampliar su negocio y de esa manera tener los recursos necesarios para heredarles a sus hijos una formación profesional.
texts.en: José has begun to make preparations to sow corn and beans and needs to buy three bags of manure, in order to have an abundant harvest.  The previous loan helped José to buy farming supplies, which resulted in a more abundant production and a higher income.  José continues to work to expand his business and to have the necessary resources in order to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy three bags of manure.

loans.name: Tugwizumwimbu Group

texts.fr:
Honorate fait partie du groupe Tugwizumwimbu et habite à Gitega. Elle a 48 ans et est mariée à Martin, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants  dont 6 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, farine, …) depuis 1 année et 4 mois.

Elle est son onzième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, farine, …) à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Honorate belongs to the Tugwizumwimbu group and lives in Gitega. She is 48 years old and married to Martin, who is a trader. They have seven children together, six of whom are studying.

She has been selling shop products (rice, beans, flour,..) for 16 months and is on her eleventh loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of shop products (rice, beans, flour...) that she will resell to make more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of shop products (rice, beans, flour,...) to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Sangwe I Group

texts.fr:
Floride fait partie du groupe Sangwe I et habite à  Gitega. Elle a 49 ans et est mariée à  Sylvestre, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  qui  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane depuis 5 ans.

Elle est à son huitième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande grande quantité de bananes pour préparer de la bière de banane à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Floride belongs to the Sangwe I group and lives in Gitega. She is 49 years old and married to Sylvester, who is a farmer. They have four children together, who are all studying.

She has been selling banana beer for the past five years and is on her eighth loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make up into banana beer, which she will resell to make more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make banana beer to resell so that she can make more money.

loans.name: Maria Piedad

texts.es:
María es una mujer adulta, se casó siendo muy joven y se divorció después de mucho tiempo, lo cual le causó mucho dolor. Tiene 7 hijos que todos son independientes. Ella vive con uno de sus hijos Jorge de 33 años quien se desempeña como albañil y también su nuera. Viven en el cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Ecuador. En este cantón se puede encontrar varios lugares para visitar como ríos y bosques que son visitados por varios turistas, quienes al coincidir en las fiestas del cantón pueden experimentar las exposiciones de artesanías y las ferias donde se exponen productos agrícolas y también ganado que son animales que conforman la riqueza de muchos habitantes. Estas actividades combinadas con el comercio han dado la oportunidad a la empresa privada para construir hoteles, hosterías y varias ofertas de servicios para turistas. Sin embargo la principal actividad de este pueblo es la agricultura y ganadería que cada año permiten que el índice de rendimiento económico suba cada año a pesar de la poca transferencia de tecnología al lugar. 
María se dedica a varias actividades en el sector agrícola como el ordeño de vacas, recolección de cacao y crianza de pollos y aunque hace algunos años tuvo un problema de salud en una de sus piernas que le impidió trabajar, ella ha seguido con la crianza y engorde de pollos “pio” lo cual aprendió desde muy niña gracias a sus padres quienes se dedicaban a esta actividad. Invierte alrededor de 10 horas cada día principalmente cuando los pollos son bebés requieren mucho cuidado por las enfermedades a las cuales son muy sensibles. 
María sueña con la puesta en marcha de una granja de crianza de cerdos y pollos, por lo que al momento empezará comprando más pollos y también ampliando los galpones, para lo cual requiere un crédito con el que además de cumplir esta misión, ella podrá incrementar sus ingresos para sus gastos básicos y además ahorrar para cuidar de su salud en los años de su vejez.
texts.en:
María married very young and divroced after a long marriage, causing her much pain.  María has seven children, all of whom are now independent.  María lives with one of her sons, 33-year-old Jorge, who works as a builder, and her daughter-in-law.  They live in the Pedro Vicente Maldonado canton in the Pichincha province, Ecuador.  The Pedro Vicente Maldonado canton has many places to visit, like rivers and forests, which many tourists go to see.  When tourists come during festivals, they can see artisan exhibitions and fayres, where farming products and cattle, which are important for many inhabitants' livelihoods, are displayed.  These events have provided private businesses with the opportunity to build hotels, hostels, and offer various services for tourists.  However the main business in this town is agriculture and cattle raising.  Every year this work increases the town's economic output, even though there is little technology in the area.

María makes a living doing various types of work, within the farming sector - she milks cows, harvests cocoa, and raises chickens.  Even though María had a porblem with her leg a few years ago, stopping her from working, she has continued to raise and fatten up chickens.  She learned this trade from a very young age, from her parents who worked in this same area.  María invests some ten hours of her day in looking after the animals.  Particularly when they are babies, the chickens need a lot of care, as they are sensitive to illnesses.  

María dreams of having a farm raising chickens and pigs.  To start on the path towards this dream, she will buy more chickens, and increase the size of her sheds.  In order to do this, María needs a loan.  She will increase her income to pay basic costs, and will also save up to look after her health in her old age.

loans.use: to buy chickens and extend the sheds.

loans.name: Unidos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNIDOS PARA EL PROGRESO” está conformada por 06 socias dedicas a prestar servicios y a las diversas actividades del comercio. Areliz tiene 19 años soltera apoya en el taller que tiene su familia esto le permite estudiar corte y confección el préstamo lo invertirá en los gastos de sus estudios comprara materiales telas hilos agujas. Su mayor deseo es ser diseñadora y tener su taller de confección de disfraces. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Areliz es la que se encuentra en medio viste polo rojo.
texts.en: The loan group "United for Progress" is comprised of 6 members who work in various service and trade fields. Areliz is 19 years old, single, and is supported by her family's workshop and this has enabled her to study dressmaking. She will use the loan to cover her education expenses such as buying fabric, thread, and needles. Her greatest wish is to be a designer and to have her own workshop. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan they are offered. Areliz is in the middle of the photo in the red top.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DANAYA est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3éme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de  AWA qui est la 1 ere de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diverses quantités de condiments avec les grossiste de de la ville de Bougouni et quelques fois de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of four women who are all married and average 45 years of age with three children each. They live in extended traditional families in the Torakabougou district of the town of Bougouni.

They got to know each other as neighbors and friends and through their business activities. In order to boost their financial capacity so that they can carry out their business activities better, they joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their third loan with the insitution. The two previous loans were repaid in full. 

This group of women sell condiments and this is the case for Awa, who is standing on the far right of the photo. With her loan she is planning to buy various quantities of condiments from wholesalers in Bougouni and sometimes in Sikasso. She sells her products at the market and from home, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit to a customer base made up mainly of women.

She expets to make an average monthly profit of 45,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es:
María, invertirá de nuevo en compra de maíz, leña, frijol, pollo y elotes.; para elaborar tamales que luego vende a sus clientes. Tuvo un beneficio con el crédito anterior de mejores ganancias, pudo ir pagando las cuotas de su préstamo, su negocio es más rentable  y tiene más clientes satisfechos.
Sus esfuerzos están enfocados en  mantener su negocio y ahorrar lo necesario para comprar su propia casa
texts.en: María will again invest in buying, corn, firewood, beans, chicken, and corn-on-the-cob in order to make "tamales" (a corn-based dish) to sell to her customers.  María's last loan helped her to earn higher profits, and she was able to make the repayments on her loan.  María's business is more profitable and she has satisfied customers.  María is focussing on maintaining her business and saving up enough in order to buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, beans, chicken, and corn on the cob.

loans.name: Darling Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Darling tiene 48 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Ocotal, casada y madre de 2 hijos. Su oficio es Enfermería, que con mucho esfuerzo lo ha desempeñado por 20 años. Su meta próxima es seguir remodelando su hogar y garantizarles a sus hijos un patrimonio condicionado. Solicita el crédito para  saneamiento de vivienda, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de su hogar. Sus planes futuros es seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su hogar, y así evitar situaciones que enfrenta durante las épocas de invierno.
texts.en:
Darling is 48 years old and is originally from the city of Ocotal. She is married and is the mother of 2 children. She works in nursing and has put a lot of effort into this role over the last 20 years. Her next goal is to continue improving her home to give her children a well-equipped asset.

She is asking for the loan to upgrade her house, with the aim of improving the quality of her home. Her future plans are to continue improving her home's infrastructure and so avoid situations which she has to deal with in the winter period.

loans.use: to upgrade her home.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, se le presenta la oportunidad de invertir más en su negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios para dama; comprara ropa para dama y caballeros (diferentes estilos, colores y tallas) también aretes, pulseras, anillos y collares; con los cuales tiene más variedad de productos a sus clientes. Con el préstamo anterior aumentaron sus utilidades, el negocio tiene nuevos clientes y consiguió ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
Su núcleo familiar se mantiene igual, todos se encuentran saludables y día con día se esfuerzan por mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos has the opportunity to invest more in his business selling clothes and accessories for women: he will buy clothes for women and men (different styles, colors, and sizes) and also earrings, bracelets, rings, and necklaces. This will give him a greater variety of goods for his customers. He used his previous loan to grow his services. The business has new customers and he continues to offer better living conditions to his family.
His immediate family stays the same and all are healthy and strive day to day to sustain the business.

loans.use: to by women's and men's clothes (various styles, colors, and sizes) and also earrings, bracelets, rings, and necklaces.

loans.name: Edwin Rolando

texts.es: Edwin Rolando de 35 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos estudia en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven el se ha dedicado a la venta de carne de pollo y embutidos, boquitas,alitas,chicharrones etc desde hace 3 años en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para la venta el deseo de el es agrandar un poco mas su negocio y tener mejores ingresos asi poder darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: Edwin is 35 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in school in the community where they live. He works selling chicken meat and sausages, finger food, wings, pork rinds, etc and has been doing this for 3 years. He is requesting a loan to buy more supplies to sell. He wishes to grow his business a little more and to have more income so that he can give his children the best.

loans.use:
to buy chicken meat, sausages, finger foods, 
wings, and pork rinds, to sell.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo is 26 years old and she lives in West Point. She is single and she is a 9th grade dropout. She been selling bags of charcoal and oil. She enjoys her business because she many customers. She requesting to have a loan to purchase charcoal and oil for her business. She hopes to have her own house and children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and oil for her business

loans.name: Difence

texts.en:
Difence is a 47-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 13 years and 16 years. She describes herself to be humble and focused. She operates a basket business where she makes baskets to sell. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of clean water. 

Difence will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank that will also benefit six family members. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Verene

texts.en:
Verene is 52 years old. She is married with five children aged between 10 and 22; they all go to school. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, se siente muy satisfecha con las ganancias que tuvo y el servicio que les da hoy en día a sus clientes gracias al préstamo que se le facilito. En está ocasión también invertirá en la compra de maíz, gas, que le ayuden a tener la materia prima necesaria para seguir trabajando y pagar su deuda.
Juana mantiene su grupo familiar igual, se encuentran muy saludables y tienen mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Juana is very satisfied with the earnings that she has had and the service that she gives her clients today thanks to the loan that she was given. On this occasion she will also buy corn and gas as it helps her to have the raw materials necessary for her to keep working and paying her debts. Juana's family remains the same. They are all in good health and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn and gas.

loans.name: Domenike

texts.en:
Domenike is a 52-year-old widowed mother of four who has been running a greenhouse for long time. She was in the business with her late husband up until five years ago. 

“Since he passed away, it has been difficult. We did almost everything together around the business and with him passing away I had to learn how to do it on my own. Sometimes I get physical help from my children, yet I remain the primary person to run the whole activity. I also have dairy cows and sell the raw milk to a nearby dairy farm,” said Domenike.

She wants to buy a watering pump for the greenhouse with this loan and she hopes that lenders will be kind to lend to her. Domenike resides in an institutional new area of services.

loans.use: to buy a watering pump for her greenhouse

loans.name: Jaqueline Esmilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Jaqueline de 25 años de edad.  Soltera con dos hijos menores de edad. Originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal que ha trabajado día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera  y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería ubicada en un lugar especifico de la localidad. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus  productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jacqueline agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is 25 years old. She is single and has 2 small children. She is originally from Sauce, a place in the north of the country. She can be characterized as hardworking and responsible with a great personal desire to overcome challenges. She works day in and day out to offer a better future to her little children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was not able to study for a degree and she had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses.
Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she has a grocery store in the town. A "pulpería" (the name for this type of store) is a small store that sells groceries in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, juices, and sodas. She runs the store for 12 hours a day, offering all her products. The goal of this loan is to have business capital and supply her store so that, in the not-so-distant future she can have a better income. Jaqueline is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to have business capital and to supply her business with groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Andryusha

texts.en:
Andryusha lives in the village of Chakaten; he's lived there from his childhood. He says he has found trustful partners in farming and agriculture – the Kiva lenders’ team and field partner Nor Horizon. 

Andryusha has a store in the town of Kapan where he sells meat, eggs and dairy products from his farm as well as products purchased from other farmers. He also breeds large-horned cattle and poultry and grows vegetables, fruits and barley on his own plot of land. He also rents out a plot of land where he cultivates wheat. The tractor that he purchased is also greatly demanded and is very often rented by the villagers. Having a degree in animal husbandry, Andryusha perfectly takes care of his farm cattle. Since his children have grown up and his daughter is already married, he is left alone in his farming activities but, being very industrious, he manages everything perfectly. 

This will be Andryusha’s second loan from Kiva. The first one he used to purchase 20 piglets as well as barley seedlings, diesel fuel and fertilizer for his farm. This time he asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to buy three cows and a bull to enlarge his cattle farm.

loans.use: to buy three cows and a bull for his farm

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa was born in the village Tokh which is in the region of Hadrut in the Republic of Nagorno Karabakh, but after getting married she moved to Kapan city, where she lives now with her family. She has a daughter and a son. Both of them are married and have children. Larisa’s husband works as a locksmith. 

Larisa has had her own business already for five years; she has a small stall where she sells a great range of fruits and vegetables. She buys her stall products from nearby village farmers every week. She sells beans, peppers, carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, and beets; she also sells watermelons, melons, bananas, apples, plums, grapes, oranges and pomegranates. Her stall is very nice one, full of colorful and tasty agricultural products. She has many customers who visit her stall every day and they are well satisfied, both with the products’ quality and the prices as well.

Larisa is asking for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of onions, potatoes and carrots for sale, which are in high demand during the winter period.

loans.use: to buy a lot of onions, potatoes and carrots for sale

loans.name: Anasthase

texts.en:
Anasthase is 57 years old. he is married with two children and they both go to school. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Olives

texts.en: Olives is 50 years old and lives in West Point. She is married to a commemorator and has five children between the ages of 8 and 24, who are currently in school. Only four live at home. For the past six years she been selling cold water in the local market. One of her major problems is that during the rainy season, she has fewer customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase fifty sacks of water for her business. She hopes to build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fifty sacks of water for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old. She is a mother of five children, and her husband works as farmer. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 46 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal wants to build a stable and he needs lenders’ help to achieve this. In the background you can see his little family house where there are five people residing: the couple and their children. They are very poor and they barely can make it. 

Pal is very happy that he was finally  given the opportunity to do something because up until now he was not eligible to apply for loans, first because his collateral was insignificant to what was requested for a loan, and secondly, no financial institutions served his area. About two months back, VFA expanded to a new area including 23 villages.

Agriculture/livestock has been the activity where his focus has been throughout most of the past ten years.

loans.use: to build a stable

loans.name: Shavleg

texts.en:
Shavleg is 26 years old, single and lives in the capital city suburb with his parents. 

He is jobless at the moment and is seeking a job, but as there is a high unemployment rate in the region it has become difficult for him to find a suitable one. The only one who makes money in the household is Shavleg’s father who is a construction worker and works on special projects.

The existing funds are modest and Shavleg decided to start his business. He plans to go to Turkey for purchasing perfumes in bulk. Shavleg will use his own car for transportation and distribute perfumes to cosmetics stores. Prices are lower in Turkey and Shavleg will get a good income. He has experience in the perfume trading business and that is the reason why he thinks he will handle the challenge.

Shavleg awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has a 22-year-old child who is living at home and working. 

For over nine years now, Victoria has been selling in a little shop in her community where she deals in many items such as rice, oil, bread, milk, etc. Sometimes there are fewer customers and it makes her feel very bad. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, bread, milk, etc. for her business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, bread, milk and etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 35 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and went to school, finishing in the 4th grade .  Her husband is a driver.  They have four children ages 13, 15, 17, and 20, who are in school.  

For more than two years she has been cooking and selling rice and soup from a shop in the local market.  Her biggest worry is the lack of customers sometimes.  Her mother showed her how to run her own business.  She is proud that the business enables her to get money to look after her family.

Hawa is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, fish, meat, vita, onion, etc., for her business.  In the future, she plan to build up some savings.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, meat, vita, onion, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Edis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Edis de 56 años, no tiene ningún nivel académico y vive junto a su hijo de 22 años de edad; el cual ha alcanzado un nivel académico de 9º grado quien además se dedica a la producción agrícola.

Edis solo se dedica a oficios domésticos, en su casa su hijo a la producción agrícola y de ganado de donde reciben sus ingresos económicos, ya que hace unos 5 meses aproximadamente falleció de ella, quien era un medio del cual ellos recibían ingresos. Pero a pesar de las pruebas duras de la vida, ella trata de salir adelante con su hijo y de alcanzar sus sueños a pesar  de las diversas limitantes.

El préstamo que está solicitando,  es  para la cancelación de un bien inmueble que les dejo su esposo y ya está en trámites de traspaso a nombre de su hijo y de ella.

Ella pretende tener una propiedad que este registrada, legalmente para que su hijo continúe desarrollando sus actividades agrícolas sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Edis is 56 and has no formal education. She lives with her 22-year-old son, who went to school through the ninth-grade and has since worked as a farmer. 

Edis works only in her home and her son's farm labor is their source of income. Edis's husband, who supported the family, died around five months ago. Despite the obstacles and challenges they've encountered, Edis and her son are striving to keep moving forward and achieve their goals.  

Edis is applying for a loan to help her transfer ownership of the home her husband left her. Edis is in the process of transferring ownership to her name and her son's. 

Edis hopes to register her home legally so that she and her son can continue farming with security.

loans.use: to pay off the home that her husband left her. Edis is in the process of transferring ownership to her name and her son's.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 46 years old. He is married with seven children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Rosario Elisa

texts.es:
En Ecuador  en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos  Provincia Pichincha vive la Sra. Rosario, ella es muy afortunada de vivir en uno de los lugares más turísticos del Cantón como lo es  la parroquia Mindo la misma que es muy visitada da por muchos extranjeros que vienen a disfrutar de sus hermosos paisajes, cabañas, cascadas y muchos lugares más. 
 Ella es madre soltera vive en su humilde casa con sus  3 hijos el primero tiene 11 años y la menor 5 años, ellos están estudiando en la escuela del sector.
Ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos;  sus padres le dieron solo la escuela primaria por la mala situación económica, en la actualidad también se le presentó un obstáculo, pues tuvo un problema en un pulmón lo cual la imposibilitó de trabajar durante 15 días.
Debido a que es cabeza de hogar no tiene mucho tiempo libre ya que aparte de su negocio de producción de pollos, también trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante del sector. Trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias pero cada vez que puede y le queda algo de tiempo aprovecha para pasar momentos agradables con sus hijos.
El negocio de los pollos fue una iniciativa propia debido a que en el sector hay varios restaurantes y es un lugar muy visitado, empezando con 10 pollos que vendió y se dio cuenta que es un negocio rentable y que no implicaría muchos gastos ya que los entregaría ahí mismo en su parroquia.
Lo más difícil de realizar en este negocio es el cuidado de los pollos cuando son pollitos bebes, debido a que hay que estar muy pendiente que no le se enfermen y si lo hacen hay que darles el cuidado y tratamiento especiales para su rápida recuperación.
La Sra. Rosario tiene varios sueños  como son mejorar y ampliar su casita e incrementar su negocio, también le gustaría en un futuro comprarse un carro para utilizarlo en el negocio.
Con este préstamo estará dando inicio a uno de sus sueños que es incrementar su negocio, comprando más pollos y ampliando los criaderos por lo cual agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la oportunidad que le están brindando de superarse y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario lives in the San Miguel de los Bancos Canton, Pichincha Provence of Ecuador. She is very fortunate to live in one of the most touristic places of the Canton, known as the Mindo Parrish, which is visited by many foreigners who come to enjoy the beautiful scenery, ranches, waterfalls, and other places.

She is a single mother who lives in a humble home with her 3 children; the oldest is 11 and the youngest is 5. They go to school in the area. Rosario comes from a family with few economic resources. Her parents only sent her to primary school due to the financial situation, which is still a challenge. She also had a problem with one of her lungs and couldn't work for 15 days.

Because she is the head of household, she doesn't have a lot of free time. Apart from her chicken production business, she also works in the kitchen of a restaurant nearby. She works an average of 10 hours a day. However, whenever she can, she takes advantage of her free time to be with her children.

She started her chicken business on her own because the area has several restaurants and it is a popular place. She started with 10 chickens and sold them. This made her realize that it was a profitable business and that there weren't many expenses because she could deliver them throughout her own Parrish.

The most difficult part of the business is taking care of the baby chicks. She has to watch them carefully and make sure that they don't get sick. If they do get sick, she has to care for them and give them special treatment for a fast recovery.
