Rosario has many dreams, including improving and expanding her small home and growing her business. She would also like to buy a car in the future to use for her business.

With this loan, Rosario is taking initiative on one of her dreams by growing her business. She will buy chickens and expand their coop. She is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa for the opportunity they are providing her to succeed and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and increase her chicken coop.

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es: Don German es originario de la Ciudad de Estelí. De 32 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo. Desde hace 6 años él trabaja como Promotor social. Es un hombre muy dedicado ya que a la edad de 16 años empezó a trabajar  para sustentar los gastos de sus estudios universitarios logrando con éxito graduarse. Solicita el crédito para saneamiento de vivienda ya que él quiere tener una mejor higiene y condición en su hogar. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar y su plan próximo es ahorrar para lograr alcanzar sus metas futuras.
texts.en: German is from the city of  Estelí. He is 32 years old, married, and the father of one child. For 6 years, he has worked as a social worker. He is a very hardworking man, since he started working when he was 16 to pay for his college education and he was able to graduate successfully. He is asking for the loan for home sanitation services, because he wants better hygiene and living conditions in his home. His plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of his home and his next plan is to save to be able to reach his future goals.

loans.use: for home sanitation services.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 41 years old. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Focas

texts.en:
Focas is 42 years old. He is married with five children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Noe Humberto

texts.es: Noé de 39 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 9 años y 2 años de edad. Es un hombre muy trabajador y perseverante que con mucho esfuerzo va sacando adelante a su familia. Se gana la vida prestando servicios de albañilería y trabajando como agricultor. Su esposa también colabora con la economía del hogar ya que todos los días prepara refrescos naturales y los vende dentro de su comunidad. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su familia, ya que habitan en condiciones muy humildes y sencillas. Desea introducir la energía eléctrica en su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el cableado y la conexión de la energía eléctrica y dar a su familia condiciones más dignas.
texts.en:
Noé is 39 and lives with his wife and two children, ages nine and two, in the family's own home. He is a very hardworking and persistent man who strives tremendously to provide a better life for his family. 

Noé earns a living doing a combination of construction work and farming. His wife also contributes to the family finances by preparing natural soft drinks each day and selling them in her community. 

Noé's goal is to improve his family's living conditions, as his home is very simple and modest. He wants to install electricity in the home and is applying for a loan from FUSAI (Fundación Salvadoreña de Apoyo Integral, Salvadoran Foundation for Comprehensive Development) to pay for wiring and an electrical connection. With electricity, the family's home will become a more dignified place to live.

loans.use: To invest in the installation of electric lighting.

loans.name: Maritza Roxana

texts.es: Maritza de 31 años de edad habita en casa propia desde hace 10 años junto con su grupo familiar el cual lo conforma su esposo y sus cuatro hijos.  Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos, su esposo trabaja en la municipalidad en la recolección de basura y de ésta forma llevan el sustento y ayuda en la economía de su hogar. Debido a su poca condición económica no habían podido optar al servicio de energía eléctrica; pero con la facilidad de pago que FUSAI le planteó se animó y adquirió un crédito con la Fundación, con el dinero realizará el cableado y la conexión de la energía eléctrica, servicio que tanta falta les ha hecho para el desarrollo de mejores condiciones de la vida en familia. Maritza con la ayuda de su esposo se han comprometido a pagar este préstamo.
texts.en: Maritza is 31 years old and has lived in her own house for 10 years along with her family which is comprised of her husband and their 4 children. She works as domestic staff and her husband works for the municipality collecting trash and this is how they support their household. Because of a lack of economic resources, they haven't been able to have electricity in their home. But, with the payment facilities offered by FUSAI, she accessed a loan from the Foundation and will use the money to get the house wired and connected to the electricity supply. Not having this has kept them from improving the family's living conditions. Martiza has promised to repay this loan with help from her husband.

loans.use: to have her house wired for electricity.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, está decidida por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de peras, zanahorias, guineos, lechugas,  berenjenas, etc.; para que su negocio tenga diversificado los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, con el crédito anterior aumento sus ingresos, amplio el negocio, y no se le presento alguna dificultad para canelar su deuda.
Su condición económica es mejor, su familia se mantiene con los mismos miembros.
texts.en:
María has decided to take out another loan to invest in buying pears, carrots, bananas, lettuce, eggplant, etc. so that her business will have diverse products to offer her customers. With the previous loan she increased her income and had no difficulty paying off her debt. 

Her financial condition is better and her family still has the same members.

loans.use: to buy pears, carrots, lettuce, and eggplant.

loans.name: Gjele

texts.en:
Gjele, who has been running her variety store for the past eight years, is in need of your financial help to stock up on inventory items. In addition to the variety store, she has been running another activity selling fruits and veggies at the local market of a nearby town and also dairy products that she and her husband produce in their own land and through the livestock activity.

“While I take care of the store, my husband goes to the market to sell the produce. But we both put an equal amount of physical work and timing into the agricultural business because it’s not that easy,” is what Gjele said at the interview.

Gjele resides in northern Albania, is 53 years old, married and has three children.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for her variety store

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county.  She is 36 years old and has six children between the ages of 9 and 21 years old.

For the past three years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market.  Some of the problems she faces is that the prices are too high.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes daily.  Having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, meat, pig's feet, and chicken feet for her business.

Her dream is to become a big business woman and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, meat, pig's feet, and chicken feet  for her business

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 29 years old. He wants to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supports labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Elisee

texts.en:
Elisee is 56 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad,  es madre soltera y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus tres hijos menores de edad.  Tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la venta de tamales de elote (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz tierno). Con sus ingresos en el negocio saca lo necesario para llevar el sustento a su hogar y para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Desea mejorar sus condiciones por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la introducción de luz eléctrica en su vivienda de tal forma que le permita a sus hijos desarrollarse de mejor manera.
texts.en: María is 47 years old. She is a single mother who live in her own house with her three minor children. She has been selling elote tamales (a food made with a base made from young corn). With the income from her business, she gets what she needs to support her home and cover her childrens' basic needs. She wants to improve her living conditions, and that is why she has made the decision to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in installing electricity in her home so her children can grow up in a better way.

loans.use: to invest in installing electricity.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of Ksh. 25,000 to purchase more materials for making bricks and for labor costs. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making bricks and for labor costs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from Spitak village. Currently she lives with her 4-year-old child because her husband went to Russia for finding a job and sustaining his family's living.

As a very hardworking woman Julieta has been involved in a retail business for five years. She purchases clothing and dressmaking materials from the city market and resells it at her village. The income from the retail business helps the family to cover its daily costs and it is very important for them. Thus, Julieta has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of clothing and sell it to her customers. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Julieta to be able to gather more income and improve her family's living conditions. She wishes that one day her husband will be able to come back home and stay with his family.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en: Gia is 59 years old from the village of Taleri. He is married and lives with his wife, two school-age children and retired parents. They are running an agricultural business and grow maize and grapes on the family-owned plot of land. Also, Gia breeds a dairy cow, three calves, a pig and six bee-hives with bee colonies. The income from the agricultural activities is modest and Gia decided to start a trading business with a loan. But the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Gia’s credit requests were rejected several times, as he doesn’t satisfy their requirements. He received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Startup Program gives vulnerable poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $2000, he will purchase second-hand shoes at wholesale prices and sell them from a stall located at the local fair market. He will offer his customers a wide assortment of well-priced products. Part of the loan will be used for purchasing a van, for product transportation. He plans to develop his trading business gradually. The startup credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a van and stock of used shoes for resale

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en:
Smbat is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his parents, wife and 5-year-old son. Smbat's father currently works abroad and tries to support his family financially. Smbat's mother and wife take care of the household and the little son and Smbat is the main breadwinner of the family. 

Smbat has been involved in the construction business for 4 years. Particularly, he provides renovation services to locals and gathers the income for his family. Now, in order to be able to purchase tools and equipment needed for his work, Smbat needs financial support. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  The loan is very important for Smbat and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing construction services

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 54 years old. She lives with her family in Vanadzor city. Anahit has graduated Yerevan State University in the faculty of Obstetrics. Now she works as a pediatrician at their city Medical Centre. At the same time she works at the school as a pediatrician. She is a very beloved and respected specialist in the region. She also loves her work and does it with love and care. 

Anahit is married and she has two children: a son and a daughter, who is already married. Her husband is a builder and from time to time he goes to the Russian Federation for abroad work.
 
Anahit asks a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some furniture for their guest room (sofa, armchairs, table and chairs).

loans.use: to buy some furniture for their guest room (sofa, armchairs, table and chairs).

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
27-year-old Yasin is a driver. He is single and lives in the Abseron region with his parents, but Yasin and his family have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Dilegarda village of Füzuli since his childhood. His old parents don’t work.

It was noted that Yasin is a driver, but he doesn’t transport passengers, he has been transporting building materials between various sides of the Absheron region for 4 years.  A few days ago his truck broke down and he can’t work. For this reason he applied to Kiva's partner organization Komak to take out a loan. He needs 800 AZN to repair his truck. He hope that if his truck is repaired, he will start to work again.

Yasin is thankful to Komak and Kiva for help. In the future, if the work is better, Yasin wants to hire an assistant.

loans.use: to repair his truck

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: Julio de 36 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 14 años, 12 años y 8 años de edad. Él presta servicios de albañilería dentro del municipio donde habita desde hace mucho tiempo. Con el fin de asegurar su terreno desea construir un muro de contención ya que con las lluvias se le está lavando. Solicita esté crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena y cemento ya que el muro lo hará de piedra la cual extraerá de un río cercano por lo que no pagará por ellas.
texts.en:
Julio is thirty-six years old.  He lives in a house that he owns with his life partner and their three children, ages fourteen, twelve, and eight.  He has worked as a bricklayer in the town where he lives for a long time.  With the goal of protecting his land against the heavy rains, he hopes to construct a retention wall.  

He is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy sand and cement.  The retention wall that he wants to make will be built mainly from stone; he will collect the stones from the river close to his house so that he doesn't have to spend extra money to purchase them.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to build a retention wall.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is involved in the retail business. He runs a small store where he sells general products for everyday use (food items, housing products, etc.). 

Armen is married and is a father of a little daughter. He is working hard to sustain his family's living. 

Now, for being able to purchase supplies for reselling at the store, Armen needs financial support. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Armen and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for selling at the store.

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.en:
Appolinaire is married with three children, aged between one and six. Only two children go to school. With the loan, he would like to use Kiva funds to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Faosta

texts.en:
Faosta is married with four school-going children. They live at their own house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Faosta has operated a  fruit and vegetable stall for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mrika

texts.en:
Mrika is building a new bar and café venue and she is photographed there. She had one up until now that she had operated for the past seven years, but now was about time to build a new place since the current one was not in good condition at all, according to her. The money that she had saved, though, was not enough to finish the construction and she is requesting lenders’ help to put it together. The amount she needs is a total of 300,000 Albanian Lek.

Mrika has four children and she comes from the very rural northern Albania. The traditional outfit she is wearing represents the region where she comes from.

loans.use: To finish building the new  bar and  cafe

loans.name: Allison Joseph

texts.es: Allison Joseph, mayor de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, responsable con deseos de superación personal, se dedica a la venta de productos varios, como: ropa de niños, bolsos, prendas de oro, plata, laminado, cosméticos entre otros, ella ofrece sus productos al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales su negocio es de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, Allison con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios ha logrado salir adelante y creciendo igual que su negocio, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir mas en sus mercadería debido a que su demanda ha incrementado mas en estas temporada, tiene ya varios encargos los cuales tiene que cubrir para así satisfacer a sus clientes. Allison agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Allison Joseph is an adult who lives in the municipality of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is characterized as being a responsible woman who is a fighter and wants to get ahead. She sells various products such as children's clothes, bags, gold, silver and laminated  jewelry, cosmetics and more. She sells her products with payment upfront and on credit to regular and new customers. She sells as a street vendor and from her house. Allison has been able to get ahead  and grow her business with a with a lot of hard work and sacrifice. The purpose of this loan is to invest more in her merchandise. Demand has grown more during this season. She already has a lot of orders that she has to fill to satisfy her customers. Allison is very grateful for the support the Kiva lenders give to people of low income.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying general merchandise such as bags, clothes, gold jewelry and more.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael de 41 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con grupo familiar. Él se gana la vida mediante la venta de refrescos y venta de panes con salchicha de manera ambulante. Es muy conocido en la zona ya que es muy amable y ofrece productos higiénicos  y sabrosos.  Actualmente, su casa no tiene corredor  y cuando llueve se filtra el agua y daña sus pocas pertenencias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la comprar de lámina galvanizada y madera de tal forma que le permita dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda con la construcción de un corredor.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 41, lives in a house on his property, together with his family. He earns his living through mobile sales of drinks and bread with hotdogs. He is very well known in the neighborhood because he is kind and offers clean and tasty products. 

Right now his house doesn’t have a corridor and when it rains, the water seeps in and damages his few belongings.  He is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets of metal and wood so that he can give greater security to his home with the construction of a corridor.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets of metal and wood to construct a corridor for his house.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is married with five children and all  her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop from the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week.  She gets additional income from tailoring. 

Prossy has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy sugar, beans, rice, flour, cooking oil and rolls of materials for making clothes. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked shop and also building rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and rent for the shop.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, beans, rice, flour, cooking oil and rolls of clothing materials for tailoring

loans.name: Akhmed

texts.en:
Akhmed is a 33-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and parents in a small village of the Bolnisi district. His father works in building and gets 400 gel per month. In addition, the family runs an agricultural business. They have 0.5 hectares of agricultural land, where potatoes, tomatoes and maize are grown. Akhmed always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. 

He decided to start a dairy business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $2,500 for purchasing cows. As the cows are purchased the family will start producing dairy products and selling them at a good price. This will increase the income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Manasse

texts.en:
Manasse is 36 years old. He has been a maize farmer for the past six years. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 30 years old. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana de 23 años de edad es soltera y habita en casa propia desde hace 15 años.  Es muy emprendedora y visionaria. Todos los días se dedica a la venta de tortillas, pupusas y enchiladas (comidas típicas preparadas a base de masa de maíz, frijoles, queso, etc.), de esta forma se gana la vida y mantiene la economía de su hogar. Desea construir una pila y un baño dentro de su terreno lo cual le facilite reguardar el agua. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, ladrillo y el pago de la mano de obra. Tiene la seguridad que con lo que gana en su pequeño negocio sacará la cuota mensual para pagar la deuda.
texts.en:
Ana is 23 years old. She is single and has lived in her own home for 15 years. She is very enterprising and visionary. Every day she sells tortillas, pupusas and enchiladas (traditional foods made from corn flour, beans, cheese etc.). In this way she earns her living and supports the family finances. 

Ana wants to construct a sink and a bathroom on her land which will help preserve the water. For this reason Ana is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying sand, cement, bricks and to pay for labor. She is certain that what she makes in her small business will cover the monthly payment to pay her debt.

loans.use: to buy cement. sand and brick to build a sink and bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Caren

texts.es:
Caren cuenta que su familia tiene cuatro miembros, ella es la hermana mayor, y por tanto es ejemplo para sus demás hermanos.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, con lo cual quiere poder ayudar a su familia y asi retribuirles todo lo que han invertido en ella. Su sueño es poder seguir luchando y creciendo para ser una gran profesional.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que tiene varios que poder cubrir.
texts.en:
Caren has four people in her family. She is the oldest sister and therefore is a role model for the rest of her siblings. She is studying nursing and with it she wants to help her family and pay them back for everything they have invested in her. Her dream is to keep fighting and growing to become a great professional. 

She is asking for this loan to invest in paying for her certification costs, since she has several to pay for.

loans.use: to pay for her

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik is 60 years old and he lives in Gavar city, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Rubik has graduated Gavar State University, but he has never worked anywhere but his farm. Rubik is marred and he has four children; three daughters and a son. All his daughters are married and they live separately from their parents. Rubik’s son is not married yet; he works at the construction company. 

Rubik and his wife are engaged in farming and they breed tree cows, a heifer, two bulls and two calves. Their farm products they sell from their house to resellers. Rubik greatly wants to enlarge his farm cattle, not being afraid of work and much expenditure connected with it. Rubik asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several cows and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy several cows and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es padre de 3 hijos es por ello que cada dia sale muy temprano a trabajar como pescador, el pesca sardinas, boquichico y bagres y los ofrece en el puerto de su ciudad, con este trabajo puede tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales para realizar un mantenimiento a su bote y poder pintarlo y mejorarlo, asimismo comprara redes de pesca,  así podrá tener una herramienta e trabajo en buenas condicione y poder seguir luchando por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener una embarcación mas grande con todos sus implementos”.
texts.en:
Juan is the father of three children.  Because of that, every day he heads out very early to work as a fisherman.  He catches sardines, prochilodus, and catfish and sells them in the city harbor.  With this work, he earns an income so that he can get his family ahead.

Juan is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy materials to perform maintenance on his boat.  He will be able to paint it and improve it, and at the same time he will buy fishing nets.  In this way he will be able to have his tools and work in good conditions and can continue fighting to make his dream a reality: to have a bigger boat with all the fixings.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and to improve his boat.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with three children all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Beatrice operates a nursery school. She has been in this business for the last thirteen years.

Beatrice wants to expand her school to accommodate more students. With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase furniture such as chairs, desks and tables for her classrooms. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as chairs, desks and tables for her classrooms.

loans.name: Juana Pastora

texts.es: Juana es una señora de 42 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí y madre soltera de un hijo que ya es independiente. Su oficio es enfermería. Ella a pesar de no tener el apoyo de nadie ha logrado salir adelante. Su meta próxima es remodelar su casa para poder garantizar a sus nietos un hogar digno donde habitar. Solicita el crédito para saneamiento de su vivienda, con el fin de tener un mejor hogar, limpio e higiénico.  Sus planes futuros es darle mantenimiento a la vivienda y seguir mejorándola para lograr un ambiente mejor.
texts.en:
Juana is a 42-year-old woman.  She is a Esteli city native, and is a single mother of one son, who is already independent.   She works as a nurse.  Despite not having support from anyone else, she has been able to move herself ahead.

Her next goal is to remodel her home in order to be able to provide her grandchildren with a dignified home.  She is requesting the loan to fix up her house, with the end goal of having a better home that is both clean and hygienic.  Her future plans are to provide maintenance to her home and to continue improving it in order to create a better living environment.

loans.use: to fix up her home.

loans.name: Hiralata

texts.en:
Hiralata is 46 years old and married. Her husband is 50 years old. Both of them have completed higher secondary education. They live in Sanghati Nagar, which is under the Dhupguri region. Hiralata has three children. Two children are completing their graduation, and another one is appearing for Higher Secondary Examination. 

From the very beginning, Hiralata has faced many difficulties in running the family. Her husband runs a grocery shop, but sales were not that much due to a lack of variety of items. From her friend, Hiralata came to know about BJS (Belghoria Janakalyan Samity) and that BJS gives loan support. So, she applied for a loan to purchase many different kinds of grocery items. This will help her family, so she is thankful and grateful to BJS.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of grocery items to increase the business.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 31-year-old married woman. She only received an education up to standard I (grade 1). Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to receive more education. 

Now Jayanti is a mother of three children, and the eldest one goes to school. She has taken a loan for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Her husband is a farmer. Both Jayanti and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children, a future that is not affected by poverty and ignorance. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream come true. 

Jayanti lives in a kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but with this loan she will try to make a pakka house (made of bricks and cement). Jayanti and her husband are successfully running their business and have taken on the market for selling milk products and also vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Yenice

texts.es:
Yenice es estudiante de Administración de empresas, cursa el Segundo Año de la carrera tiene por objetivo y meta terminar sus estudios y montar su propio negocio, su aspiración es ser una gran administradora de su propio negocio y así poder solventarse a si misma y a su familia.
Ella comenta que da todo de sí para poder cumplir con la facultad, ya que sabe lo importante que son los estudios y quiere poder mejorar su vida por medio de esto.
Hoy pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de transportación, además agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Yenice is business administration student. She is in the second year of her major and her goal and objective is to finish her studies and open her own business. She aspires to being a great manager of her own business and thus support herself and her family. 

She says that she gives everything of herself to be able to earn her degree, since she knows how important her education is and she wants to improve her life this way.

Today she is asking for a loan to invest it in transportation costs. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting and it will be a big help.

loans.use: to pay for transportation costs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa quiere ser abogada, es por eso que está escuchando la carrera de derecho, ella es una personas muy dedica a sus estudios, y día a día va mejorando cada vez más.
 Comenta que su familia es la que siempre la ayuda y está a su lado brindándole toda la ayuda que necesita, y por medio de su carrera quiere poder retribuirles.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar cuotas de la universidad, y así poder cubrir ese gasto y seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Elsa wants to be a lawyer so she is studying Law. She is a person who is very dedicated to her studies. Day by day she continues to improve. She comments that her family helps her and is at her side giving all the support necessary. And through her career she will be able to repay them. Elsa is requesting this loan to invest it in paying her university fees. Being able to cover this cost she can then continue to study.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Taron

texts.en:
Taron is 37 years old and he lives in the village of Gugark, which is in Lori region. He is married and he has a son and a daughter. Taron works in the city of Vanadzor where he rents a garage and provides car repair services. He does changes or repairs of car engines, car transmission boxes and other car equipment. He has many loyal clients and he works with great responsibility. That is why he is always busy with work.

Taron asks for a loan of 150,000 Armenian drams in order to buy car spare parts for his work.

loans.use: to buy car spare parts for his work

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 23 years old. He is married to a maize farmer. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Morlai

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Morlai. He is married and has two children, who are five and twelve years old. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help educate his sister's child.

In 2007, Morlai established his camera and accessories business. He became self-reliant after he graduated from technical school. His business is located in the city center, and his primary customers are adults. By working seven days per week and twelve hours per day, he earns approximately 925,625 SLL every month from this business.

He is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Morlai would like this loan in order to pay for additional camera accessories. He hopes that this loan can improve his inventory and increase his profits. In the future, Morlai plans to expand his business to another part of town. He explains that he started the business as a trainee, and that he now owns the business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional camera accessories

loans.name: Dimpna

texts.es:
La Sra. Dimpna es madre soltera vive en su casa propia con su hija.
Ella tiene una heladería bien surtida con sabrosos helados que fabrica una amiga de ella. 
Consiguió montar su Heladería  con un poco de dinero que había juntado con el trabajo que realizo cuando se fue a trabajar en el extranjero durante 4 años. 
Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio. Ella quiere seguir trabajando para darle a su hija todo, y que no tenga que pasar por necesidades.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de un congelador, para que así siga trabajando, en post de ir mejorando.
texts.en:
Dimpna is a single mother who lives with her daughter in a house that she owns.  She has an ice-cream store that is well-stocked with delicious flavors, all made by one of her friends.  She started her ice-cream shop with a little money that she earned while working abroad for four years.

She is a very fighting and honest woman, well-known and loved by everyone who lives in the neighborhood.  She wants to continue working in order to give her daughter everything she needs.

She is requesting this loan to buy a freezer.  This will allow her to continue working and improving.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her ice-cream store.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Caren appreciates the support for her previous loan: it improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.She would like to apply for a loan of 35,000 KSH to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man who is very hardworking and responsible. He has two children: one in school and one underage. He lives at his own house that has electricity and piped water. For the past two years, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites high cost of maintanince being his major challenge. He is also a supplier of sand and blocks.

With the 40,000 KES he wants to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle.He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle

loans.name: Edith Yamileth

texts.es:
Edith, está acompañada; vive en casa familiar con su compañero de vida y una hija de 11 meses, por iniciativa propia ella estableció su venta de mariscos, no tiene ningún problema en atenderla, es un negocio que le se le facilita poder estar pendiente de su familia y atender a sus clientes.
Comprara variedad me mariscos (pescado, conchas, camarones, otros) también una hielera para conservar frescos y en buen estado el producto.
Su sueño es apoyar a su compañero de vida en los gastos de su familia, ahorrar para comprar su casa propia y darle un futuro mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Edith lives in a family house with her husband and an 11-month-old daughter. On her own initiative, Edith has established a business selling seafood. She has no trouble in attending to it; she can take care of both her family and her customers.

Edith will buy a variety of seafood (fish, shellfish, shrimp, and other items), and also a refrigerator to keep her products fresh and in good condition.

Edith's dream is to help her husband with family expenses, to save to buy a proper house, and to provide a better future for her daughter.

loans.use: buy a variety of seafood (fish, shellfish, shrimp and other items), and also a refrigerator.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 23-year-old married woman, and her husband is 33 years old. By occupation, her husband is a van puller. They have two children, and one is going to class VIII (grade 8).  Sabita lives in Magurmari of the Jalpaiguri District. 

Sabita is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband passed class V (grade 5). Her husband’s income is too low to run a family by himself and to care for their two children. Like every mother, Sabita also dreams to give her best to her children. So, she plans to do something on her own. 

She has taken loan from BJS (Belghoria Janakalyan Samity) to buy seeds for potato cultivation. The field in which she is standing is now being used for rice cultivation. After the rice season is over, she will rotate the crops and harvest potatoes in the same field. Her condition will be a bit upgraded. She is really thankful and grateful to BJS.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Massah. She is divorced and has three children aged 5, 10 and 22. In 2006, Massah established her textiles business. She began her business to be self-reliant after divorcing her husband. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 911,797 every month from this business. 

Massah would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Massah has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional cotton, lace and batik. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise her profit.

Massah started the business selling on market days and now has a stall. In the future, she plans to expand the textile business to a busy market out of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cotton, lace and batik.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has three children aged 2, 5, and 12. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to assist in the business. 

In 2003, Isatu established her provision, toiletries, drinks and cosmetics business. She began her business to be self-reliant and to assist her husband with the education of their children. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 803,000 every month from this business. She started the business selling on market days and now has a shop. 

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to pay for additional drinks. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise her profit.  

In the future, Isatu plans to expand her drinks business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 40 years old.

He is seeking a Kiva loan to cover labor costs and to buy fertilizers, both of which he hopes will help him increase his maize harvest. He would like to reinvest the profits he expects to generate from his farming activities as a result of this loan so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and to pay labor costs for maize production

loans.name: Bilkis

texts.en:
Bilkis is a 23-year-old married woman living in the Jalpaiguri district of Magurmari. Both Bilkis and her husband are illiterate. They just know how to sign their names. 

Now she is a mother of two children. The elder one is going to class IV (Grade 4), and the younger one is studying in class II (Grade 2). Bilkis wants to give her children the best future, so she wishes to purchase a cow so that they can earn money by selling milk and milk products. By occupation, her husband is a farmer. The earnings from her husband are not enough, so she has shifted to another sector so that she can earn more money and run their family. 

Bilkis is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save money so that she can continue her family and give a good future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Nelson Ulises

texts.es: Nelson de 47 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijos. Él es muy emprendedor y visionario quien se gana la vida haciendo trabajos de albañilería, electricidad, fontanería y de pintura general. Sabe hacer muchos oficios lo cual le da oportunidad de trabajar en muchos lugares. Desea  completar el baño y el servicio sanitario con la construcción del pozo de absorción, solicita crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales pétreos (arena, grava y piedra) que colocará como material filtrante dentro del pozo.
texts.en: Nelson is 47 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and children. He is hardworking and enterprising and makes a living doing odd jobs such as bricklaying, electrical work, plumbing, and painting. He has a lot of skills, which gives him the opportunity to work in a lot of places. He wants to finish the bathroom in his house by building a soakaway pit. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy the materials (sand, gravel, and stone) to use for filtering inside the pit.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, and stone to build a soakaway pit.

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es: Blanca de 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer admirable  ya que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse al negocio de la venta de verduras tales como tomates, cebollas, y chiles. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su comunidad y es así como se gana la vida y colabora con la economía de su casa. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su familia, desea introducir la energía eléctrica en su vivienda ya que hasta la fecha nunca a contado con el servicio. Solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión e introducción de dicho servicio que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en: Blanca, 51 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her family. She is an admirable woman who gets up very early every day to work in her business selling vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, and hot peppers. She sells her produce from door to door in the main areas of the community, which is how she makes a living and is able to contribute to her household's finances. Hoping to improve her family's living conditions, she wants to install electricity in her home, which they have never had. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in installing that utility, which they need so much

loans.use: to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has two children aged 2 and 5. 

In 2010, Isatu established her provision, toiletries, drinks and rice business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant and to assist her husband with the upkeep of their home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 453,709 every month from this business. She started the business selling soap and now has added provisions.  

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to pay for additional rice. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise her profit. 

In the future, Isatu plans to expand the rice business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for rice.

loans.name: Pjeter

texts.en:
Pjeter lives in northern Albania and has five children. All of his children attend public school.

To earn a living, Pjeter sells raw milk and baby calves at the local market. Currently, his animals live in the shack you see in the background of the photo.

Pjeter explains that his region is known for bitter cold weather and snowy winters. Last year, one of his grown-up calves died from the cold, and it was very upsetting to him because he could not prevent it from happening. Right away, he put a stove into the shack, which is why you can see a pipe sticking out of the pictured shack, and burned wood to warm up his animals. Even with the stove, however, he was very sad to awake one morning to find that his calf was no longer alive.

As a result, he no longer wishes to have his animals sleep and live in such harsh conditions. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to build a stable for his animals.

loans.use: to improve his animals' living conditions by building a stable

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 48 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos desde hace 12 años. Se gana la vida como albañil  desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como junto a su esposa llevan el pan de cada día a su hogar. Con el fin de darle condiciones más seguras a su familia, ha tomado la decisión de mejorar el muro perimetral de su casa ya que se encuentra deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita a FUSAI este crédito para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, ladrillo, y cemento para reparar el muro de su casa y  además con el mismo material mejorará el techo de la cocina de su casa ya que la lámina esta picada y el agua se filtra; se ahorrará el pago de la mano de obra ya que él mismo realizará las obras.
texts.en: Manuel, 48 years old, has lived in his own home with his wife and children for 12 years. He has been working as a mason for a long time, and that is how he helps his wife support their family. Hoping to make his family's lives safer, he has decided to improve the perimeter wall of their house, which is deteriorating. He is therefore requesting this loan from FUSAI, which he will use to buy galvanized sheet metal, bricks, and cement to repair the wall. He will also improve the roof of their kitchen, as the current roof is damaged and leaky. He will save money on labor costs by doing the work himself.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, bricks, and cement to repair the wall around his home.

loans.name: Noemi Elizabeth

texts.es: Noemi de 20 años de edad es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años. Habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 11 años. Ella trabaja como empleada en una empresa industrial y de esa forma es como lleva el sustento a su familia y va sacando adelante  su hijo. Desea terminar de construir una casa que hace unos meses comenzó  pero no logro terminar por falta de dinero. Ella habita en condiciones muy humildes, en el mismo terreno tiene su casa la cual está construida de lámina, pero su deseo de superación la ha llevado a construir poco a poco esta nueva casa la cual espera terminar lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines para techar la casa y poder hacer uso de ella.
texts.en: Noemi, 20 years old, is unmarried and has one 4-year-old son. She and her family have lived in their own home for 11 years. She is employed in a factory and so is able to help support her family and improve her son's life. She hopes to finish building a house that she started a few months ago but has been unable to finish because of a lack of funds. She lives in quite humble conditions. Her house, which is built of sheet metal, is on the same piece of land. But she dreams of a better life and so has been slowly building this new house, which she hopes to finish as soon as possible. She is therefore requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will use it to buy galvanized sheet metal and poles to build the roof of her house and be able to use it.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and poles to build the roof of her house.

loans.name: Gladis Haydee

texts.es: Gladis de 41 años de edad habita en casa propia desde hace 12 años. Vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Es muy trabajadora y responsable; desde hace mucho tiempo trabaja como empleada en un comedor y una tortillería en el mercado central del municipio donde habita. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, la cual es su principal patrimonio.  Para esto solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada para reparar el techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra picado y se filtra el agua cuando llueve. También, desea invertir en la compra de cemento y arena para encementar el piso que también está deteriorado.
texts.en: Gladis, 41 years old, has lived in her own home for 12 years. She lives with her life partner and their children. She is very hardworking and responsible. She has been working at a restaurant and at a tortilla stall in the local market where she lives for a long time. She wants to improve the conditions in her home, which is her primary asset. She is therefore requesting a loan from FUSAI, to be invested in buying galvanized sheet metal to repair the roof of her house, which has holes in it and leaks when it rains. She will also buy cement and sand to repair the crumbling floor.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, and sand to repair the roof and cement floor in her home.

loans.name: Nelson Alexander

texts.es: Nelson de 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto  a  su compañera de vida y su hijo de 8 años de edad. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes, pero tiene mucha energía para trabajar y seguir luchando para mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Nelson presta servicios de seguridad en una empresa del municipio donde habita y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda así como reparar el corredor de su casa que se encuentra dañado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construcción de cuarto y reparación de corredor.
texts.en: Nelson is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their 8-year-old son. They live in humble conditions, but Nelson has a lot of energy to work hard and keep struggling to improve his family's situation. Nelson works as a security guard at a local company and supports his family that way. He wants to build a bedroom in their home and do repairs in the corridor, which is damaged. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI so he can buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to build the room and repair the corridor.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to build a bedroom and repair the corridor.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta de 56 años de edad habita en casa propia  junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su madre de 79 años de edad  y sus tres nietos. Tiene 25 años de trabajar como masajista dentro de su comunidad. Muchas personas la prefieren ya que están muy satisfechos con el servicio de masajes que presta. Hace unos meses terminó de construir las paredes de un cuarto el cual ahora desea ponerle el techo y el piso para poder habitarlo. Solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena, grava y pagar la mano de obra necesaria que le permitan terminar el cuarto de su casa.
texts.en: Berta, 56 years old, lives in her own home with her 79-year-old mother and her three grandchildren. She has been working as a massage therapist in her community for 25 years. Many people prefer her services because they are very satisfied with the massages she gives. A few months ago she erected the walls for a bedroom in her home, and now she wants to install a roof and floor so it will be habitable. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI so she can buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, sand, and gravel and pay for the labor needed to finish the bedroom.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, sand, and gravel and pay for the labor needed to finish building a bedroom.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 16 años de edad. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de su localidad. Trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su hijo ya que ella es el único soporte económico para él. Con el fin de tener mayor seguridad para ella y su hijo, ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar e instalar nuevas puertas y ventanas de su casa ya que las actuales están muy deterioradas.
texts.en: Rosa, 44 years old, is unmarried and has one 16-year-old son. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in the local market for eight years. She works very hard to make life better for her son, since she is the only one who takes care of him. For the safety of herself and her son, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase and install new doors and windows in their home, as the current ones are in very bad shape.

loans.use: to purchase and install new doors and windows in her home.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es: Timotea tiene 47 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y su hijo de 16 años de edad. Ella es pequeña comerciante de ropa para dama, caballero y niño. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en el mercado de su localidad. Es muy trabajadora y muchas personas dan buenas referencias de ella como una mujer responsable y emprendedora.  Su casa es muy sencilla pero propia y actualmente el techo se encuentra dañado  y es necesario que se repare. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la comprar de lámina galvanizada y reparar el techo además comprar cemento y arena para encementar el piso ya que en la actualidad es de tierra y no es muy saludable para su familia.
texts.en: Timotea, 47 years old, lives in very humble conditions with her husband and their 16-year-old son. She has a small business selling clothing for men, women, and children. She sells her goods in the local market. She works very hard, and many people speak highly of her as a responsible, enterprising woman. Her house is quite basic, but it is hers. At the moment the roof is damaged and needs to be repaired. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI so she can buy galvanized sheet metal and repair the roof. She will also buy cement and sand to install a cement floor, as the home's dirt floor is not hygienic for her family.

loans.use: buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, and sand to repair the roof and install a cement floor in her home.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, se está preparando para surtir sus productos, ella invertirá en la compra de lociones, cremas corporales, cosméticos, que sus clientes le demandan. Para Sandra la inversión anterior le ayudo a aumentar el número de clientes,  a mejorar los ingresos, pagar sus cuotas y así salir de sus deudas.
Con su economía mejorada ha logrado ampliar su casa, se encuentra saludable, y muy positiva en seguir trabajando para que su negocio se mantenga a la vanguardia.
texts.en: Sandra is getting ready to restock her products. She will buy lotions, body creams, and cosmetics to meet her customers' needs. Sandra's previous loan helped her increase her customer base, increase her income, and pay off her debts. Thanks to her improved financial situation, she has been able to expand her house, and she is in good health and feeling optimistic about working to keep her business vibrant.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is a 31-year-old married man. He and his wife have one child, and they live in Mombasa, Kenya.

For the last eight years, he has been buying and selling green maize to earn a living. He explains that the business has really grown in recent years.

He learned about Milango through friends, and he decided to join so that he could access credit for his business and ultimately save more for his family's living expenses. He is now seeking a loan to buy more bags of green maize for re-sale purposes. He hopes that his business will expand from a retail business to a wholesale business in the next five years despite the usual challenges, such as competition. He plans on using the extra income he expects to generate from his business as a result of the loan to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of green maize for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is married with one child. He has been a maize farmer for the past eight years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizers for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest profits from his farming in his business so that he can acquire machines and tractors in the future that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs for maize production

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married, with four children, all of whom go to school.She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She sells "makuti" (thatching materials made from palm leaves), and she has been in this business for five years.She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.She also operates a food stall business.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase more makuti for resale.  She expects to do this without any difficulties, and to continue working without any problems

loans.use: to purchase more "makuti" for resale

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una, y así ir trabajando. Cada una está dando lo mejor de sí para mejorar, capacitarse e ir creciendo.
Juana es parte de este grupo, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en su propia casa, y cuenta también que al principio fue un poco duro empezar, pero que gracias a su arduo trabajo, a la ayuda de su familia y a las capacitaciones que recibe ha ido mejorando. Ella quiere seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia, es por eso que sigue esforzándose.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtir su negocio con productos variados, como ser comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, frutas y demás. Agradecen también por esta oportunidad que tienen.
texts.en:
This group is completing the poverty elimination survey to better understand each members' situation and then get to working. Each member is giving their all in order to improve themselves, train, and continue growing. 

Juana is a member of this group who manages a small grocery store out of her own home. She remembers how it was a little hard to get started in the beginning, but that thanks to her hard work, the help of her family, and the training she has received things have improved. She hopes to continue growing and helping her family. That's why she keeps putting for the effort. 

She is requesting this loan in order to stock her business with a variety of products such as foodstuffs, beverages, dairy products, fruits, and other items. The group is also grateful for the opportunities that they have.

loans.use: purchase foodstuffs, beverages, dairy products, fruits, and other items.

loans.name: Andrés Alexander

texts.es:
Andrés de 24 años, estudio hasta noveno grado, por diversas circunstancias de la vida no continua estudiando. Él solamente está acompañado y su compañera de vida trabaja en una casa desempeñando los oficios domésticos. Ellos solo tienen una hija de 2 años de edad que vive junto a ellos, en su vivienda también viven sus padres y 3 hermanos mas pero ellos no dependen de él, las personas que dependen del solo es su esposa y su hija. 

Andrés se dedica a trabajar en estructuras metálicas, como soldador, tiene 6 años de trabajar, sus hermanos mayores desempeñaban la misma actividad y por eso él aprendió el oficio de soldador; como vio que era una actividad que generaba buenos ingresos económicos. Por eso decidió, dedicarse a soldar, aparte de ser soldador en los tiempos libres también se dedica a cultivar la tierra en la agricultura (siembra de granos básicos). 

Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad solo estudiaba y a la agricultura. Andrés, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que tomar 2 buses a una distancia aproximadamente de 8 kilómetros, en la actividad que desempeña, un hermano más realiza el oficio de soldar y es horario es estable de 7 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.   

El préstamo lo utilizara para la remodelación de su casa, construirá una habitación,  para estar más cómodo con su familia, comprara 300 bloques, un metro de arena y 5 bolsas de cementó esto les permitirá vivir más cómodamente con su esposa y su hija, este proyecto ha sido un deseo que han tenido desde hace tiempo, de tener su propia habitación para su familia. 


Para el futuro Andrés, desea tener su propia casita para vivir con su esposa y su hija, tener un mejor empleo para mejorar sus ingresos. Él espera para su hija, que sea una persona de bien que pueda terminar sus estudios hasta una carrera universitaria y con el apoyo del crédito, le permitirá generarle una oportunidad de superación con este crédito y futuros.
texts.en:
Andres is 24 years old and has a ninth grade education.  He was not able to continue due to many life’s circumstances.  He is married and has a two year old daughter who lives with them.  His wife works as s housekeeper.  His parents and three siblings also live with them but they are not dependent on him.  Only his wife and daughter are dependent.

Andres works as a welder on metal structures and has been doing so for six years.  His older brothers also work the same trade and this is how he learned to weld.  He saw that this generated good income, so he decided to become a welder.  Aside from that, he also works as a farmer (raising basic grains) in his spare time.  Before doing this, he was just a farmer.

Andres takes two busses for a distance of 8 km to get to his place of work, where he and one of his brothers weld.  It’s a stable schedule from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.

He will use the money from this loan to remodel his home so that his family will be more comfortable.  He will buy 300 cinder blocks, a cubic meter of sand, and five bags of cement.  This will allow him and his wife and daughter to live more comfortably.  They have wanted to do this for some time and have a house for his family.

Andres wants a home of his own so he can live with his wife and daughter, and have a better job so that he can improve his income.   He wants his daughter to become a person of means with a university education and this and future loans will help generate an opportunity for success.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco, a sus 49 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Durante 12 años trabajó como empleado en una empresa, pero después de tantos años no había adquirido nada y se sentía estancado, pues el salario que recibía sólo le alcanzaba para suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Por esta razón decidió retirarse de la empresa y aventurarse a trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía y medias de manera ambulante, en un pequeño puesto que las autoridades de espacio público le otorgaron en el centro de la ciudad, allí atiende todos los días de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm y gracias al empeño, la perseverancia y a la dedicación con la que ha trabajado, logró adquirir 2 casas y le ha brindado educación a sus hijos, durante los 10 años que lleva en funcionamiento. Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (medias), y así abastecerse para la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, época en la cual se incrementan sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Francisco sueña con fortalecer aún más su negocio y en un futuro tener la posibilidad de montar su negocio en un almacén más grande, que sea rentable y le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Francisco is 49 years old, has three children, and is in a common law marriage.  He worked as an employee for 12 years but after so many years he did not advance and he felt stuck because his salary was not enough to meet the basic needs of his household.  So he decided to leave the company and try his luck at working as an independent merchant selling different merchandise and socks on foot in a public space in the city center.  He works there every day from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm and he was able to buy two houses, and provide an education for his children, thanks to the dedication, and perseverance he has put into his work over the past ten years.  He is asking for this loan to buy merchandise in quantity (socks) to stock up for the approaching Christmas season, when his sales and income increase.  Francisco wants to strengthen his business and in the future be able to start a larger store that will be more profitable and will allow him to have stable finances so he can provide is family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (socks).

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a hardworking and enterprising woman.She has operated a fish selling business for the last two years, selling at the market to her neighbors’ and passersby.She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Apart from her fish selling business, Agnes also sells makuti (a roof thatch made from palm leaves). With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join and to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Khazangul

texts.en: Khazangul, 44, is married and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two infant grandchildren in the village of Kirachmughanlo. Khazangul’s husband is a welder and works from his house on special projects. The family runs an agricultural business and grows tomatoes as well as cucumbers to sell. Besides these, they breed livestock and sell meat seasonally. In order to generate more income, Khazangul decided to start up a grocery store in front of her house but found she didn’t have enough money to do so.
