texts.es: Duo Luz de Vida, representado por doña Gloria de 64 años, vuida, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, en un local que alquila en el centro de San Lucas Sac, desde hace 3 años, ahora doña Gloria desea también vender zapatos americanos, porque su clientela se lo demanda,por ese motivo esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Calzado y ropa de segunda mano.
texts.en: The Luz de Vida group is represented by 64-year old Sra. Gloria who is a widow. She has been selling American clothing in rented premises in the centre of San Lucas Sac for three years. Now Gloria wants to sell American shoes also because her customers are asking for them. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy secondhand footwear and clothing.

loans.use: buy secondhand footwear and clothing

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
A married woman who lives in a rural village located in the Srey Snom district of Srey Snom province, Ratha is 27 years old and has two children all of whom are still in school. Ratha is a  rice farmer in the local area and she supplements the income by selling grocery items. She earns about 30,00KHR but is able to save about 15,000KHR each day.

Ratha has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy grocery items to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Touch, 38, has four children in total. Three of them are in school. Touch and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for ten years to make a living.

Touch is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Touch will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her growth of healthy rice and to better her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Phay's Group

texts.en:
Phay, who is 39 years old, is married and living with her family in a village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two children. 

For the past 10 years, Phay and her husband have been farming rice as the main source of family’s income to make a living. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about KHR 27,000 per day from their current business. 

Phay’s group consists of three members.  She is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Phay, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: La Sra. Noemi  tiene 34 años casada con tres hijitos,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la su propio domicilio,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Noemí  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de electrodomésticos que necesita e insumos como abarrotes, aceite y papa,  la Sra. Noemi    enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a la venta de comida pero ella les atiende con mucha amabilidad que hace que sus clientes vayan por ella y el buen sazón que le pone a sus comidas, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una restaurante para poder brindar comodidad a su clientela y  así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Noemi is 34 years old, married, with three small children. She sells food at her food stall located in her own home. This loan is her first with the institution.

She is going to use this loan to purchase home appliances that she needs, and supplies such as groceries, cooking oil and potatoes. Noemi faces challenges in her business such as competition, as there are several people who sell food; but she offers friendly service, so her clients come looking for her and her tasty cooking. 

Her wish for her business is to continue selling meals, and have a restaurant so that she can offer comfort to her clients, be able to make her business grow, improve her income, and therefore improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy home appliances and supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 56-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be focused. She does farming to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be the lack of rainwater for her harvest. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy iron sheets for roofing her house. They will enable her to harvest rainwater during the rainy season for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in farming. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre muy trabajador, para poder obtener ingresos y poder llevar un pan a su hogar trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de maíz y menestras, Samuel le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad.

Samuel está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar más menestras como lentejas, arvejas, pallar, fréjol, entre otros, así podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Ser un gran comerciante”.
texts.en:
Samuel is a very hard working man. In order to be able to earn income and support his household, he has a small business selling corn and legumes. Samuel works in his business for around nine hours a day, and believes it is going well because he offers quality products. 

Samuel is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to buy more legumes such as lentils, peas, lima beans and other beans.  This will enable him to offer a greater variety of products to his customers, to improve his income and to strive to make his dream a reality: "To be a successful merchant."

loans.use: To buy legumes at wholesale.

loans.name: Savoern

texts.en:
Savoern, 35, lives with her husband and three children in a village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Two of her children are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for ten years and they supplement the family’s income by working as a tailor. She is able to earn about 5US$ per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Savoern has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. She is requesting another loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting, to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and also to buy a sewing machine to support her tailoring business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Evolution 2.1 Group

texts.en: Jean Maurice is the leader of the group Evolution 2.1, consisting of four micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. He is married and has a one child who is five years old. Jean Maurice has been with HOPE Congo for three loan cycles and will be using his portion of the loan to purchase more furniture to enhance his store, which he has been operating for the past eleven years. In order to grow his business, Jean Maurice believes that a positive attitude and prayer are keys to having success in the future. His goal is to grow his business and expand into other areas of the city. With this growth, he hopes to invest in a new house for his family and to invest in the education and medical care of his kids.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his shop.

loans.name: Evolution 2.2 Group

texts.en: Patricia is the leader of the group Evolution 2.2, which consists of four micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Patricia is married with three children, ranging in age from 14 to 25. This is Patricia's third loan cycle with HOPE Congo and will use her portion of the loan to purchase clothes in bulk for her store, which she has been operating for the last six years. One of the challenges that Patricia faces is dealing with the seasonal nature of her business and knowing when certain items will be in demand. In the future, Patricia hopes to continue to grow her activities due to her strong financial aptitude. Additionally, the increased income that she hopes to earn from her business will be put towards a constructing a new home for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her clothing store.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 30-year-old married man. He has one child who is five years old. He describes himself to be determined. He does farming to earn a living. He also runs a taxi business to earn extra income. He describes his family challenge to the lack of water for irrigation causing them to plant late. He will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water pump and pipes to pump water to his farm so that they can irrigate their crops. This will enable them to have sufficient water for irrigation. He hopes that in the future, there will be food security. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He repaid his previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy water pump and pipes

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be self reliant. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low business. He will use the KES 13,900 loan to buy cooking gas. His family of six members will be able to cook efficiently. He hopes that in the future, he will own a hard ware store. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cooking gas.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 53-year-old man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 26 years. He describes himself to be aggressive. He does farming to earn a living. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to buy a water pump and water pipes. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water pump for pumping water to irrigate their farm. Irrigation will help them to produce more crops to sell. He hopes that in the future, they will make maximum use of their land and utilize the available water resources to maximum benefits. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen forma parte del grupo de crédito Arco Iris, se encuentra realizando su tercer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo, el cual le gusta por el compañerismo y la unión existente en el. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida como el mirador ya que desde su parte más alta se observa gran parte de la ciudad, este lugar es muy turístico, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.
La Señora Carmen tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que vive es de familiares.
Doña Carmen se dedica a las tareas de su hogar, pero aporta a la economía de su hogar gracias a la crianza de animales como son: pollos, cerdos, cuyes, ganado, también con la agricultura que es más para el consumo de su hogar. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y alimento para animales. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen is part of the Arco Iris [Rainbow] credit group.  She is currently taking her third loan alongside her friends and groupmates. She likes the group because of the companionship and bond that exists in it.  She lives in the vicinity of the Turi parish in Cuenca.  This parish is known as the “Mirador,” or Vantage Point, because from the highest point you can see most of the city; this place is very touristy.  The people work raising animals and farming, and many work in various jobs in the city.

Señora Carmen is 36 years old.  She lives in a common-law relationship and has a 3 year old child.  Her husband works as a construction worker.  The house they live in belongs to relatives.

Doña Carmen works doing the housework, but she also supports her household raising animals such as chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and cattle, and also through her gardening, which is more for her family to eat.

She is going to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of chickens, pigs, and animal feed.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Evolution 2.3 Group

texts.en: Claire is the leader of the group Evolution 2.3, which consists of four micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. She is married with four children who are currently in school. This is Claire's third loan cycle with HOPE Congo and she is going to use her portion of the loan to purchase additional stock of used clothing for her store, which she has been operating for the last 21 years. Claire has noticed that prices in the market have been increasing and that towards the end of each month her sales typically drop due to lower demand. In the future, Claire hopes to overcome these challenges by adding additional locations and to be able to travel to have more direct contact with her suppliers. She is known in her community for being warm and welcoming and dreams one day of improving the housing conditions for her family and sending her children overseas to study at university.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing stock for her store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be very social and friendly. She farms to earn a living. She describes her biggest family challenge to be that they travel long distances to fetch water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a water pump and pipes. They will be able to pump water to their home for domestic use. This will benefit six family members. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and pipes.

loans.name: La Vigueur 2.2 Group

texts.en: Emma is one of the members of the group LA VIGUEUR 2.2, which consists of seven micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. She is married with 6 children, ranging in age from 10 to 27. This is Emma's second loan cycle with HOPE Congo and she will use her portion of the loan to purchase powdered milk and sugar to make cream, which she sells at her business along with salted fish and other drinks. One of the challenges that Emma faces is very low sales during the dry season (June through August), but she hopes to increase her activities now that the wet season has arrived. She cites saving with HOPE Congo as a critical strategy that will help her overcome her challenges and grow in the future. With increased revenues, Emma will put money towards constructing a new home for her family and financing her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to use for her creamery.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposa en casa propia, él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y honesto, desde a hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de un potrillo que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita
texts.en: Jorge is 45 years old. He lives with his wife in their own house. He is a hard working, responsible and honest man. For many years, he has dedicated his life to breeding cattle in the area in which he lives. He has very good clientele and has earned the trust of his clients. He offers quality and good prices. He has decided to invest in the care of his animals since that is what his business depends on. For this reason, he has requested a loan in order to be able to buy vitamins for his animals and to adjust for the purchase of a colt that will permit him to expand in the business. With this he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue to afford the economic help that his family needs so badly.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and a colt.

loans.name: La Vigueur 2.3 Group

texts.en: Rose is one of the members of the group LA VIGUEUR 2.3, which consists of five micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. She is married with 5 children, all of whom are currently in school. This is Rose's third loan cycle with HOPE Congo and she is going to use her portion of the loan to purchase additional stock for her business, which consists of selling plastic materials such as chairs. During the past 15 years of running her business, Rose notes that there is significant variation in her purchasing power due to the fluctuation of exchange rates, since her products are often produced outside of the Congo. In the future, Rose hopes to become a successful businesswoman and be able to send her children to the best schools in the city.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs to sell.

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es:
José de 40 años,  logro cursar  educación media. Esta acompañado, su señora le ayuda en el negocio(venta de comida). La hija mayor (7 años),  esta estudiando primer grado de educación básica. Con él también viven sus suegros, que de igual forma se involucran en le negocio. 

Él ha instalado una  venta  comida,  se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, su familia siempre se ha dedicado a este tipo de negocio,  el local donde vende, esta a una cuadra de su casa, este es un negocio familiar y  trabajan  toda la semana. 

El dinero lo necesita como capital de inversión , para ofrecer mas productos, ya que este local se encuentra en una zona, donde hay bastante demanda, es un lugar muy transitado por la gente. Su negocio esta frente a la entrada del hospital nacional.

Con esta inversión, su familia obtendrá mayores ingresos, que le servirán para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Sin el crédito se limita a ofrecer  un servicio de poca calidad y muy escasa diversidad de productos , los cuales generan  poca ganancia.

Él desea que con el tiempo, el negocio pueda generar rentabilidad y poder  sustentar a su familia de los ingresos percibidos de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Jose is forty years old, and completed his secondary education. His wife helps with the business by selling food. His oldest daughter (seven years old) is in first grade. His in-laws also live with him, and they are also involved in the business.

He has set up a food shop, and has been dedicated to this for five years. His family has always worked in this type of business. This premises where he sells is a block from his house. This is a family business where they work all week.

José needs the money as a capital investment in order to offer more products. His business is located in an area where there is much demand because people often travel through it. The business is in front of the entrance to the national hospital.

With this investment, his family will obtain a better salary that will improve their living conditions. Without credit, they are limited to offering low quality service and scant diversity of products that generate little revenue.

With time, José would like the business to generate a return and sustain his family with the earnings received from this activity.

loans.use: To purchase more items in order to offer a greater variety of food products.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
La señora Martha tiene 44 años de edad, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella y se dedica desde hace15 años a la venta de todo tipo de ropa como faldas, blusas, pantalones etc.
Doña  Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de faldas, blusas, vestidos, camisetas, calcetines, etc. y de esta forma tener la mercadería necesaria para continuar con sus ventas y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes.
Doña  Martha espera que la inversión que realice a su negocio le genere las utilidades suficientes para poder salir adelante con su familia  y a la vez espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
Doña  Martha su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados y  así puedan tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Martha is 44 years old. She lives in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa, in the center of Honduras. She has two children who depend on her and she has dedicated 15 years to selling many different types of clothing like skirts, blouses, pants, etc.

Martha is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman. She needs a loan to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, tank tops, socks, etc., and thus she will have the required merchandise to continue with sales and to cover her customers orders.
 
Martha hopes that the investment in her business will generate sufficient profits for her to be able to move forward with her family and at the same time she hopes her business will continue growing. 

Martha’s dream is to see her children graduate so that they are able to have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To purchase skirts, blouses, dresses, shirts, underwear, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan de 35 años de edad vive con esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, es un hombre trabajadora y responsable, desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta y crianza de ganado de engorde  en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  así poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Juan is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in his own house. As a hard working and responsible man, he has dedicated the past 6 years to the sale and care of feed cattle in the area where he lives. He has a strong client base because he has known how to earn the trust of his customers. He offers quality and reasonable prices. He has decided to invest in the care of his cattle since his business depends on that. Because of this, he is asking for a loan to buy vitamins and enriched feed for the cattle so that he can continue to provide a better quality of life, without limitations, for his family.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Sandra Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene 35 años de edad, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras, se dedica desde hace11 años a la venta de todo tipo de ropa como faldas, blusas, pantalones etc.
Doña  Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora y la mayoría de sus clientes son los vecinos de su colonia, su mama le ayuda con su negocio y también recibe otros ingresos por que vende conos y gas, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de faldas, blusas, vestidos, camisetas, calcetines, etc. y de esta forma tener la mercadería necesaria para continuar con sus ventas y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes.
Doña  Sandra espera que la inversión que realice a su negocio le genere las utilidades suficientes para poder salir adelante con su familia  y a la vez espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
Doña  Sandra su sueño es en un futuro tener su propia casa.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old and lives in a neighborhood in Tegucigalpa in the heart of Honduras. She has worked for 11 years selling all types of clothes, such as skirts, blouses, pants, etc.
 
Sandra is an entrepreneur and a hard working woman, and the majority of her clients are neighbors from her part of the city. Her mother helps with her business, and she also receives other income by selling cones and gas. She needs the loan to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, shirts, socks, etc., and in this way will have the necessary merchandise to continue her sales and meet the needs of her clients.

Sandra hopes that the investment in her business will generate sufficient profits so that she can move forward with her family, and at the same time she hopes that her business continues growing. 

Sandra dreams of having her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, shirts, socks, etc.

loans.name: Sreynich

texts.en:
Residing in the Stoeung Sen District of Kampong Thom Province, Sreynich is 19 years old and single.  Sreynich has struggled to make a living through employment at one company in a local area.  Sreynich has been engaged in her job for several months and she is able to earn about $3 per day to support the family. 

Sreynich has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before.  Now, she is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund.  She requests a loan to pay for her university tuition fees, where she is specializing in accounting.  She hopes this loan will enable her to pursue her degree so she can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees.

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is 23 years old and single.  He is from a small village called Attel near Tulkarm. Abdel lives with his parents in a small house. His father was a worker, and now Abdel works in a small farm to help his family with part of the family expenses. 

Abdel raises chickens to sell their meat and eggs to the local market. It is a good business, but because Abdel is new in this field, he needs some support to develop it. 

Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chicks and feed for his farm. This will help him to develop his farm, and  his income will increase. 

Abdel appears in the photo on his farm

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for his farm
